Rename base-minimal/post-ssh to base-minimal/post

This matches the change already made the job config.

Also, sync the ignore_errors from base.

commit_message:
Add new Sahara repositories for split plugins

The code of each plugin is a filtered subset of the code
currently available in sahara.git.
Most of the settings are inherited from the existing sahara
repositories (without translations for now, it will be fixed
later).
Make the new repositories known to zuul and
configure the gerritbot notifications.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/628210
Change-Id: I036788e795bdd6cb9cfbe99a38f8542e6eb1c3a1

commit_message:
Add publish-to-pypi template to placement

We'd like to make an early release of a working placement from the
extracted repo so it is time to add the publish-to-pypi template to
make that possible.

The pypi side of things is ready:
https://pypi.org/project/openstack-placement/

Change-Id: I7e2f4af868c2f31caed828ffc4417e25710eb26e

[{'created': '2019-01-04 14:13:59.000000000', 'message': 'Mark some basic tests as smoke tests

When running tempest with "tempest run -s", only tests that are tagged
as "smoke" tests are executed.
It's useful to also run a couple of monasca tests during a smoke run
to confirm that at least the basic functions are working.

Change-Id: Iffb4148fd93577809260e1e926f46c8c4cdcdcb9
Story: #2004700
Task: # 28721
'}]
commit_message:
Mark some basic tests as smoke tests

When running tempest with "tempest run -s", only tests that are tagged
as "smoke" tests are executed.
It's useful to also run a couple of monasca tests during a smoke run
to confirm that at least the basic functions are working.

Change-Id: Iffb4148fd93577809260e1e926f46c8c4cdcdcb9
Story: #2004700
Task: # 28721

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 13:45:25.000000000', 'message': 'Technical vision: hide implementation details

As discussed at the Technical Vision session at the OpenStack Forum
in Berlin, make sure the interoperability guidance in the vision
calls out avoiding leakage of backend implementation details and
configuration choices into the end user experience (particularly
when it comes to altering API methods and their behaviors).

Change-Id: Ib15f7c20b4fc3f85dd90172373175b2b179d492e
'}]
commit_message:
Technical vision: hide implementation details

As discussed at the Technical Vision session at the OpenStack Forum
in Berlin, make sure the interoperability guidance in the vision
calls out avoiding leakage of backend implementation details and
configuration choices into the end user experience (particularly
when it comes to altering API methods and their behaviors).

Change-Id: Ib15f7c20b4fc3f85dd90172373175b2b179d492e

Looking at the list of changes, I was a bit worried about this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Iaf49d6b7942343104e0b40b6db89b78a793b858b

But it looks like that's only for CI so not something we need to worry about here.

The other one that looks like a violation of stable branch policy is:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Ia32176eb33737e6f7425bd5e63b4f95eb595cd5f

But that is clearly not tested in any way, nor was there a release note or documentation or anything with that change, so I'm not sure what need there was to backport it."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-12-03 16:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note that kolla does not assert stable:follows-policy, and it is considered one of the deployment projects where that does not apply.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-03 16:00:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Given kolla doesn't have the stable:follows-policy tag anyway, maybe it doesn't matter if keystone federation support was backported. I'm not sure exactly how deployment projects work wrt stable policy.

subject: Catch OSError when trying to get the last_update from git
messages: [{'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-07 06:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-07 07:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-07 14:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 06:28:15.000000000', 'message': 'Catch OSError when trying to get the last_update from git

The "git" executable might not be available (eg. in build environments
where the .git dir is anyway no there because tarballs are used). In
that case, the current code failed with an

OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

exception. This is now catched and the code works even if "git" is not
available.

Change-Id: I10f69d1b2cadced4cd155ef9b7f700a2806f44f9
'}]
commit_message:
Catch OSError when trying to get the last_update from git

The "git" executable might not be available (eg. in build environments
where the .git dir is anyway no there because tarballs are used). In
that case, the current code failed with an

OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

exception. This is now catched and the code works even if "git" is not
available.

Change-Id: I10f69d1b2cadced4cd155ef9b7f700a2806f44f9

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Update s3 bucket name for snapshot repositories

This changes the s3 bucket name in the Elasticsearch chart to
follow domain name constraints by removing the underscore

Change-Id: I12dd9397850f854984bccbe190227f542eb577c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-02 15:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'Render playbooks minimal, move everything to roles

In zuul, roles can be easily included cross repos, while playbooks need
to be replicated and copied.
This change creates roles, and move tasks to be included in the new
roles, so the playbooks are just minimal, and replicating them is not a
problem since the logic is in roles that are included

Change-Id: Ie51fcfbee79727d04fca47d26a5ed8ad44ed3bf6

commit_message:
Render playbooks minimal, move everything to roles

In zuul, roles can be easily included cross repos, while playbooks need
to be replicated and copied.
This change creates three roles roles, and move tasks to be included in
the new roles, so the playbooks are just minimal, and replicating them
is not a problem since the logic is in roles that are included
The common variables are loaded in the role common, the node preparation
i moved to the prepare-node role, and it's now called in the pre,yaml
playbook in pre-run.
run-test role contains the rendering of bash scripts and effective test
run

Taiga-id: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/112
Change-Id: Ie51fcfbee79727d04fca47d26a5ed8ad44ed3bf6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 03:34:02.000000000', 'message': 'Enable quota system and set qgroups

This change implements the machinectl quota system and qgroups when
they're enabled and available. This change is being implemented to
resolve an issue where machinectl based containers using a loopback file
system spam DMESG with the following:

* BTRFS error (device loop0): could not find root $INT

While various upstream sources say this error is benign[0], it raises
an inconsistency flag within the host system and is speculatively the
cause of our inconsistent read-only/Full-FS issues we've seen in the
integrated gate. Once the qgroups are properly setup the system will
remove the inconsistency flag and the message spam will stop.

* BTRFS info (device loop0): qgroup scan completed (inconsistency flag cleared)

To resolve this issue the quota system is being enabled by default
within the "lxc_host" role. This change essentially acknowledges
the built-in quota system and when enabled provides for the ability
to set / define specific quota (qgroup) options as necessary. While
many deployers may never use these options or this tooling, the role
will now properly set everything up should it ever be needed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1651435
Closes-Bug: #1753790
Depends-On: I34a41ac8a9fe4419254284c83f4600efee274c04
Change-Id: Ica79472568799098ebf83c6cefc585f117975f37
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable quota system and set qgroups

This change implements the machinectl quota system and qgroups when
they're enabled and available. This change is being implemented to
resolve an issue where machinectl based containers using a loopback file
system spam DMESG with the following:

* BTRFS error (device loop0): could not find root $INT

While various upstream sources say this error is benign[0], it raises
an inconsistency flag within the host system and is speculatively the
cause of our inconsistent read-only/Full-FS issues we've seen in the
integrated gate. Once the qgroups are properly setup the system will
remove the inconsistency flag and the message spam will stop.

* BTRFS info (device loop0): qgroup scan completed (inconsistency flag cleared)

To resolve this issue the quota system is being enabled by default
within the "lxc_host" role. This change essentially acknowledges
the built-in quota system and when enabled provides for the ability
to set / define specific quota (qgroup) options as necessary. While
many deployers may never use these options or this tooling, the role
will now properly set everything up should it ever be needed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1651435
Closes-Bug: #1753790
Depends-On: I34a41ac8a9fe4419254284c83f4600efee274c04
Change-Id: Ica79472568799098ebf83c6cefc585f117975f37
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Access to the object separate from parsing allows us to use

commit_message:
Split parser creation and parser for inventory

Access to the object separate from parsing allows us to use
argparse-manpage to generate a man page in the Debian package
automatically. We also need to set 'prog' explicitly rather
than let it be picked up via argv[0] so that when we load
the parser via argparse-manpage it produces the right value.

Change-Id: I654b4408444f804f900951333a6ebc3372d5037e

commit_message:
ceilometer: --skip-metering-database is gone

Option --skip-metering-database is gone since OSP13
(I6b262dd440a72f25662b64d938ab9e5328709a97).

This change removes it.

Closes-bug: #1743563

Change-Id: I675dc4985cdb3a86fac0a8421518ff3d7c784214
(cherry picked from commit 60f6300e9bbd255a8a8f65d7ed5b50cbb5e4e662)

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ica39496623eaba4797067d077cf822548562ca1d

commit_message:
Use templating for nova cell database_connection

Nova now allows use of templated urls in the database and mq
connections which will allow static configuration elements to be
applied to the urls read from the database per-node. This should
be a simpler and less obscure method of configuring things like
the per-node bind_address necessary for director's HA arrangement.

This patch addresses the templated DB urls as part 1.

Nova support added here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578163/

Related-Bug: 1808134

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If30b4647bca210663a22fd653e752d4d57345bdd

commit_message:
Fail multiple executions of config-download of the same plan

Add an initial task to the config_download_deploy workflow that queries
for existing executions of the same workflow on the same plan. If any
are found, that means that config-download is already running on the
existing plan, so we should fail the additional one that is trying to
start.

Change-Id: I967ae5528834382b6ef69cc4dac10c893c907fc8

commit_message:
Fail node cleaning on timeout

The Use of a retry with continue-on causes the task
wait_for_provision_state to finish in success. We need another
task to test the provisioning state and conditionally fail
based on that.

Closes-Bug: #1796293
Change-Id: I94fe438a05c3d20b927f9fe1bc8cc3ea10d85f1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-05 12:37:17.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust ssh timeouts

Generic driver jobs are failing because of timeouts when
establishing the initial ssh connection from manila-share
to the service VM.

Bump up the default value of the connection timeout for paramiko
client and also set the banner timeout since the failure occurred
during banner exchange.  Set the two timeouts to the same value
for now.  This ensures that the connection timeout is at least as
long as the banner timeout and there is no current need in manila
to control these independently.

This is more of a workaround than a real fix since a real fix
would remove the delay during banner exchange.  I suspect that
the real fix will need to be in neutron/ovs though.

Change-Id: Ib5e59faaf9667b9cb5e7d4072531b7d6c3d4da39
Partial-bug: #1807216
(cherry picked from commit 7548706b0928f2c23bf27e10d116ceca585660e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust ssh timeouts

Generic driver jobs are failing because of timeouts when
establishing the initial ssh connection from manila-share
to the service VM.

Bump up the default value of the connection timeout for paramiko
client and also set the banner timeout since the failure occurred
during banner exchange.  Set the two timeouts to the same value
for now.  This ensures that the connection timeout is at least as
long as the banner timeout and there is no current need in manila
to control these independently.

This is more of a workaround than a real fix since a real fix
would remove the delay during banner exchange.  I suspect that
the real fix will need to be in neutron/ovs though.

Change-Id: Ib5e59faaf9667b9cb5e7d4072531b7d6c3d4da39
Partial-bug: #1807216
(cherry picked from commit 7548706b0928f2c23bf27e10d116ceca585660e4)

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.14

Update to the latest available Ansible 2.5.x release.
This includes security fixes for several recent CVEs.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16837
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16859
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16876

commit_message:
Exclude build request marker from server listing

When listing "real" (already in cell) instances e.g. from
nova_cell1.instances table, a marker option means "start after the
instance with marker".

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns vm2 only.

But for VMs from nova_api.build_requests table it's different.

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns both vm1 and vm2.

This patch excludes instance with marker from listing for
instances from build_requests table.

Closes-Bug: #1808286
Change-Id: I5165b69f956fbf1904112a742698b2739f747e72
(cherry picked from commit 2ef704cba619a149336692311c2614742aa32909)
(cherry picked from commit 3eb0ba988f4cfca4399c92cd6bb7b4ae8665720c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 18:15:07.000000000', 'message': 'Removing pip-missing-reqs from default tox jobs

Change I1b02384494ae9f440b72b98d9ae5f31d88dc8967 removed the
tox env entry for pip-missing-reqs but did not remove the job
from the envlist.

This means that if you run tox with no args it will run that job,
using the default venv setup with takes time but runs no tests.

Change-Id: I8355372da93b93cc1c7f7a1501af0fbd01eee615
'}]
commit_message:
Removing pip-missing-reqs from default tox jobs

Change I1b02384494ae9f440b72b98d9ae5f31d88dc8967 removed the
tox env entry for pip-missing-reqs but did not remove the job
from the envlist.

This means that if you run tox with no args it will run that job,
using the default venv setup with takes time but runs no tests.

Change-Id: I8355372da93b93cc1c7f7a1501af0fbd01eee615

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 09:19:21.000000000', 'message': 'Disable object skew warnings

Ceph will issue a HEALTH_WARN in the event that one pool has a
large number of objects compared to other pools in the cluster:

 "Issue a HEALTH_WARN in cluster log if the average object
  number of a certain pool is greater than mon pg warn max
  object skew times the average object number of the whole
  pool."

For OpenStack deployments, Gnocchi and RADOS gateway can generate
a large number of small objects compared to Cinder, Glance and
Nova usage, causing the cluster to go into HEALTH_WARN status.

Disable this check until the skew evaluation also includes the
size of the objects as well as the number.

Change-Id: I83211dbdec4dea8dca5b27a66e26a4431d2a7b77
Closes-Bug: 1804846
(cherry picked from commit 33f9bae6c7eba61b931191882f0696db909fb84e)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable object skew warnings

Ceph will issue a HEALTH_WARN in the event that one pool has a
large number of objects compared to other pools in the cluster:

 "Issue a HEALTH_WARN in cluster log if the average object
  number of a certain pool is greater than mon pg warn max
  object skew times the average object number of the whole
  pool."

For OpenStack deployments, Gnocchi and RADOS gateway can generate
a large number of small objects compared to Cinder, Glance and
Nova usage, causing the cluster to go into HEALTH_WARN status.

Disable this check until the skew evaluation also includes the
size of the objects as well as the number.

Change-Id: I83211dbdec4dea8dca5b27a66e26a4431d2a7b77
Closes-Bug: 1804846
(cherry picked from commit 33f9bae6c7eba61b931191882f0696db909fb84e)

commit_message:

It looks in [1] that this job is not used anywhere.
Tempest scenario test are run in neutron-tempest-linuxbridge job which
is defined in neutron repo already [2].

commit_message:
DNM: ssbarnea testing change via depends-on

Note: Once tested on rdo we should also test on upstream zool via
https://review.openstack.org/625576

Apparently is not possible to combine dependson from multiple gerrit
servers as they both fail with: 
This change depends on a change that failed to merge.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625576/

commit_message:
cleanup: remove unnecessary package installations

We are installing a lot more packages than needed, we can rely
on implicit dependencies to be pulled in instead of defining
a wide-set things to install.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary update identity relations calls

The call to update_all_identity_relation_units() from
leader_init_db_if_ready() when db is already is
initialized gets triggered in many situations when
it is not necessary.

Call after migrate_database and at end of shared-db changed
is unnecessary as identity-service-changed hooks will run
driven by related charms after shared-db relation is complete
and database is initialized.

Change-Id: I952c8c64376b1332328c46e27f7f6004bf7c80e4

subject: Add benchmark storage cluster action
messages:
[{'account_id': 27053, 'date': '2018-04-28 17:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27053, 'date': '2018-04-28 19:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27053, 'date': '2018-04-28 19:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-05-09 09:57:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Stephen

This looks like useful work, however it would be nice to line up to the general charm standards for writing benchmarks:

  https://jujucharms.com/docs/stable/authors-charm-benchmarks

It also occurred to be that having this as part of the ceph-mon charm might not be desirable - its not un-typical for ceph-mon units to be deployed on hardware with lower capacity networking (i.e. < 10GBps) whereas the ceph-osd's might have 10/40/higher GBps networking.

I'd not block on inclusion in the ceph-mon charm but we might want to have a principle load-generator charm 'ceph-loadgen' for testing in this type of deployment."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 12:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-28 17:59:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add benchmark storage cluster action

Use `rados bench` to perform write, sequential read, and random read
Ceph storage cluster benchmarks.  Allow pool, duration, and number of
threads to be specified.  For write benchmarks, also allow object size
to be specified.

Use `rados cleanup` to clean up benchmark data.  By default, do not
clean up data after a write benchmark is performed.

Change-Id: I67d0d089e6e6576d3e820dd141424b23dc0c9c01
'}]
commit_message:
Add benchmark storage cluster action

Use `rados bench` to perform write, sequential read, and random read
Ceph storage cluster benchmarks.  Allow pool, duration, and number of
threads to be specified.  For write benchmarks, also allow object size
to be specified.

Use `rados cleanup` to clean up benchmark data.  By default, do not
clean up data after a write benchmark is performed.

Change-Id: I67d0d089e6e6576d3e820dd141424b23dc0c9c01

commit_message:
Add three new actions to the Ceph OSD charm

* list-host-osds - lists mounted OSDs for a given unit
* disk-for-osd - returns the block device backing a given OSD
* osd-for-disk - returns the OSD ID (if any) for a given disk

Including unit tests for the above three actions.

Change-Id: I849c22beab8e246a9e5293590b7d7c1d71da9487
Closes-Bug: #1720099

subject: provide backend_host in per-backend sections
messages:
[{'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:23:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thank you for working on this!  While I agree that we need to make this happen, the current implementation will break existing deployments.

When using the stable charm the cinder-volume service identifies itself like this: 'cinder-volume    | cinder@cinder-ceph'

When upgrading to this proposed fix the cinder-volume service identifies itself like this: 'cinder-volume    | cinder-ceph@cinder-ceph'

Maybe we need a compability kludge here, i.e. set `backend_host` to 'cinder' if `service` == 'cinder-ceph'. Or do you have any suggestions on how to retain compability with existing deployments?"}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

On second thought statically setting it to 'cinder' will not work.  Is it possible for the subordinate to get the service name of its principal?"}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Frode,

It looks like the cinder code will always use this <backend_host>@<backend_name> if backend_host is present

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/stable/queens/cinder/cmd/volume.py#L97-
def _launch_service(launcher, backend):
# ...
    backend_host = getattr(CONF, backend).backend_host
    host = "%s@%s" % (backend_host or CONF.host, backend)
# ...
        server = service.Service.create(host=host,
                                        service_name=backend,

It is possible to get a remote unit name and a service name out of that, plus there is a helper function to do that: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/v0.18.11/charmhelpers/core/hookenv.py#L232-L240


Do you suggest that we handle the first backend of the same type (same relation endpoint) as before by using remote unit service name <remote_service>@<backend_name> and everything else as <backend_host>@<backend_name>?

The problem with that is that different cinder-ceph applications are not aware of each other so "the first", "the second" etc. numbering is something that will have to be coordinated via cinder and propagated to subordinates which introduces additional complexity. Also we have a single storage-backend relation for different types of backends (not necessarily Ceph).

Another way to handle this would be a feature flag but that introduces a maintenance burden. From the high-level it would allow checking if multi-backend-enabled cinder-ceph version has been deployed and, if not, fallback to not setting backend_host offering to do some work on the changing service name.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 12:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]

provide backend_host in per-backend sections

In order to support multiple Ceph clusters related to the same Cinder
global host config needs to be overridden via backend_host config.

Change-Id: Ibe0e8e0d22886c9996ed2a07ae1b04378136356e
Closes-Bug: #1773800

subject: Allows to specify pg_num to be used for ceph pool
messages:
[{'account_id': 27052, 'date': '2018-06-22 17:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27052, 'date': '2018-06-22 18:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-06-26 06:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:43:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi Marian

I'd like to understand the motivation for this new config option; the weight and expected-osd-count options in clients and ceph-mon are designed to allow end users to balance the weight of data in the ceph storage cluster, with the weight being used in the storage pgs calculation based on the number of OSD's.

A raw config option such as this really does allow end-users to shoot themselves in the foot.

Is there a use-case you can't fulfill via the existing features?"}, {'account_id': 27052, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi James. When customer deployed this charm (sing defaults) they got 32768 PGs in a pool. They think their good number is 1024. And it would be easier to set specific number using this patch compared to calculating what weight they would need to set to achieve the same. They ended up deleteing and defining the pool manually with ceph commands.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]

commit_message:
Allows to specify pg_num to be used for ceph pool

If ceph-pool-pgnum is specified, it will be used directly as pg_num
in ceph pool create command instead of calculated value.
In such case ceph-pool-weight is ignored.

Change-Id: I180c6e228e8aeaec9949f300983ee3f9518bebf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 09:05:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cronjob file removal in update_nrpe_checks()

The cron stats file had been removed if the management_plugin was not enabled.
As the rabbitmq-stats cron job is calling the collect_rabbitmq_stats.sh
script, what is creating the /var/lib/rabbitmq/data directory with proper
permissions, the check_rabbitmq_queue nrpe command cannot run properly, because
it is trying to redirect the output to the non-existent /var/lib/rabbitmq/data/.

This change is moving the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py conditional block out of
the cronjob creation block, and fixing the block placement introduced by
change Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95

Change-Id: I98d44f5a3d047f1632a314fc43e172652e215ef6
Closes-Bug: #1779171
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cronjob file removal in update_nrpe_checks()

The cron stats file had been removed if the management_plugin was not enabled.
As the rabbitmq-stats cron job is calling the collect_rabbitmq_stats.sh
script, what is creating the /var/lib/rabbitmq/data directory with proper
permissions, the check_rabbitmq_queue nrpe command cannot run properly, because
it is trying to redirect the output to the non-existent /var/lib/rabbitmq/data/.

This change is moving the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py conditional block out of
the cronjob creation block, and fixing the block placement introduced by
change Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95

Change-Id: I98d44f5a3d047f1632a314fc43e172652e215ef6
Closes-Bug: #1779171

Bifrost does not perform ironic online data migrations after upgrading. This
can lead to the following error during kayobe seed service upgrade:

The database is not compatible with this release of ironic (10.1.7). Please run
"ironic-dbsync online_data_migrations" using the previous release.

As a workaround, perform the migrations in kayobe, prior to performing the
upgrade.

Story: 2004308
Task: 28657
'}]
commit_message:
Perform ironic online data migrations prior to seed upgrade

Bifrost does not perform ironic online data migrations after upgrading. This
can lead to the following error during kayobe seed service upgrade:

The database is not compatible with this release of ironic (10.1.7). Please run
"ironic-dbsync online_data_migrations" using the previous release.

As a workaround, perform the migrations in kayobe, prior to performing the
upgrade.

Change-Id: I8951242ba40158c26e85377254d19085d85cf753
Story: 2004308
Task: 28657

subject: Removes broker_req from mon's relation_get to avoid pool creation retrials for every hook called.
messages:
[{'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:50:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure I understand the context for this change; the bug referenced really relates to ensuring that identical broker requests in ceph-mon are not re-processed.

This review performs a secondary relation data mutation in the event that the broker request has been completed - this will cause further hook execution events across all ceph-mon units.

I think leaving the data intact is just fine - infact if the charm changes what it requests, then the current code will just keep on working, mutating the relation data and causing the broker request to be re-processed in ceph-mon."}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-12 18:18:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not sure I understand the context for this change; the bug
 > referenced really relates to ensuring that identical broker
 > requests in ceph-mon are not re-processed.
 > 
 > This review performs a secondary relation data mutation in the
 > event that the broker request has been completed - this will cause
 > further hook execution events across all ceph-mon units.
 > 
 > I think leaving the data intact is just fine - infact if the charm
 > changes what it requests, then the current code will just keep on
 > working, mutating the relation data and causing the broker request
 > to be re-processed in ceph-mon.

The main problem of this bug is that ceph-mon calls radosgw hook-related functions for very hook call it gets (OSD hooks, client hooks, etc). You can find it on https://github.com/openstack/charm-ceph-mon/blob/master/hooks/ceph_hooks.py#L480 and L418. For every notify_radosgw call, it checks relation data and tries to build anything defined on broker_req. Which means that, if we do not take broker_req out of ceph-mon's relation, it will tries to recreate radosgw related pools after a osd hook call, for example."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 12:47:50.000000000', 'message': "Removes broker_req from mon's relation_get to avoid pool creation retrials for every hook called.

Change-Id: I7f4deec0bbd7c22a77021bf2f1bbd7485f564761
Partial-Bug: #1773910
"}]
commit_message:
Removes broker_req from mon's relation_get to avoid pool creation retrials for every hook called.

Change-Id: I7f4deec0bbd7c22a77021bf2f1bbd7485f564761
Partial-Bug: #1773910

commit_message:
Correctly upgrade package and refresh config

Currently, when the charm is upgraded, the package and configs are kept
at their old versions, despite users passing new resources.

This commit ensures the package and configs are modified when calling
upgrade-charm.

Change-Id: I3996082c19d4ff867ba43e64a155b610ba68af96

commit_message:
Neutron-api checks shared-db before OS migration

Migrating OpenStack versions without correct database set up for
neutron-api may cause it to crash.
To avoid that, when OpenStack migration is demanded, the charm must
wait for a shared-db to be available before moving data with
neutron-db-manage command

Change-Id: I39f9915301a88920e78ed839d57408fd2909cab0
Closes-Bug: #1785839

commit_message:
ensure we only add the policy.json in queens+

This is required because the underlying template
file is only presented in Queens and greater, leaving
previous releases to throw exceptions when the template
is not found.

Change-Id: Iaf284700bc9ff9d31310c45a675b8db2c84ed904

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and

    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27363, 'date': '2017-12-18 06:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27363, 'date': '2017-12-18 06:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27363, 'date': '2017-12-18 06:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-12-20 09:50:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Hi Kamala

Thanks for raising this review; the process of osd activation is handled separately to preparing the device so I'm not sure this change is really needed - are you hitting a specific issue?"}, {'account_id': 27363, 'date': '2017-12-21 05:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Hi James, But when i tried to deploy ceph-osd on partition , it was failing with an error "Unable to find the block device" /dev/sda2 (/dev/sda2 is the partition where i wanted to deploy ceph-osd)

On analysing logs,could observe that ceph-disk prepare command was executed for disk partition(some warning message here i found) but the activation of disk partition logs were missing (which was happening for disks).

So when i did externally "ceph-disk activate /dev/sda2" found that ceph-osd deployed on this /dev/sda2 partition successfully.

So i thought of adding this command in ceph-osd charm , so that we can deploy ceph-osd on partition successfully without any issues.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]

commit_message:
Do not create OSDs on directories if the directory doesn't exist

Before creating an OSD out of a directory, need to ensure that
the path exists. If the path doesn't exist, the code will create
the directory and it may be on an unintended partition (e.g. the
same partition as /).

This prevents the OSD from being created if the path doesn't
exist.

Change-Id: I5d10cf7b2a9b63951ff034a0f6bf46a21b6ac6f0
Closes-Bug: #1590945

commit_message:
Switch to single relation between API charm and lb

The charm spec for OpenStack Endpoint Load Balancer currently
specifies three relations between an API charm and the load balancer
, one for each endpoint type. This merge proposal moves the spec to
use a single relation and pushes the logic and updates the interface
to support sending data about multiple relations.

The is mp is really a place for discussion and I think it requires
a PTL +2 to land.

Change-Id: I73f2baedf34fb5a83d3a736803e7e033fd0d6c97

[{'created': '2018-01-26 18:19:21.000000000', 'message': 'Added NRPE monitoring for cluster partition state

The current RabbitMQ charm does not have built-in monitoring for
the RabbitMQ cluster partition state.

This feature was requested by our operations team, but also in
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1548679

The implementation in this merge request is very similar to the
existing queue length monitoring. The cluster state is retrieved by
running plain rabbitmqctl from cron as root, output is saved into a
data file that is checked by the nrpe plugin script.

Another option could be to use the Management API, but in our
environment it is not enabled.

Change-Id: I75cf162e141342de2bd9d2d59b5410d56413cf6d
Closes-Bug: 1548679
'}]
commit_message:
Added NRPE monitoring for cluster partition state

The current RabbitMQ charm does not have built-in monitoring for
the RabbitMQ cluster partition state.

This feature was requested by our operations team, but also in
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-rabbitmq-server/+bug/1548679

The implementation in this merge request is very similar to the
existing queue length monitoring. The cluster state is retrieved by
running plain rabbitmqctl from cron as root, output is saved into a
data file that is checked by the nrpe plugin script.

Another option could be to use the Management API, but in our
environment it is not enabled.

Change-Id: I75cf162e141342de2bd9d2d59b5410d56413cf6d
Closes-Bug: 1548679

commit_message:
Add osd-shared, create osd on mounted devices

Addes logic to create and activate partitions on devices that have
mounted partitions. No changes are made to hooks, the utils library is
updated to handle partitions where it previously bailed.
* Build ceph-disk flags in function to re-use current logic in
osdize_dev
* Shared osd's implement all options/logic of the osdize_dev
 * Checks for in use
 * Handles the format osd option
 * Works with dmcrypt
 * Will not format/zap non-ceph partitions

This includes two drive-by fixes for bugs which it didn't make since to
break out. Both changes are in code which was altered in this
patch and not closing them would require implementing the bug to avoid
closing it.
* Partitions are wiped before zapping
* Zap is done via charmhelpers instead of using the ceph-disk option

Closes-Bug: #1743278
Closes-Bug: #1743280
Closes-Bug: #1743282

Change-Id: I2450a427520b6713abc457374421c94bb7f16078

commit_message:
add reactive charm testing instructions

Currently the guide does not mention how to run functional tests for
reactive charms. It only takes one deployment and looking at a log to
figure out what is wrong with running tox -e func27 from an unbuilt
reactive charm directory, however, it is good to have this mentioned in
the guide for unexperienced charm developers.

Change-Id: I76c43dd231d1b0d7a7fbd0eed0500287c93cab75

Once the charm-helpers change is reviewed and committed I will update this review.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-08 21:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-08 21:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

charm-helpers changes need to land first.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-22 20:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-22 20:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-23 22:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

So I'm approving, but I'd like thedac/gnuoy/jamespage to look at it as well. The code is fine.  I'm worried about the implications of allowing direct injections of policies via a config key vs the principals of charming and also a maintenance perspective.  It just feels wrong."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-24 23:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Currently oslo.policy provides only file-based approach to policy enforcement (RBAC + ABAC based on attributes supplied in a token and target attributes).

There is an effort to have Policy in Code (static defaults) and it is documented that operators should be able to override Policy in Code and default policy files with their own:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

There is no service to centrally store policy and a blueprint that used to be related to that is no longer a priority:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/dynamic-policies-delivery 

Congress project is not related to RBAC or ABAC - it allows to use policies of a different kind.

The best we can do in terms of having a service to authorize a user dynamically by using rules stored elsewhere is to use http checks in policy files, however, those still need to be defined in policy files and certainly not for every API call to avoid overhead.
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/reference/api/oslo_policy.policy.html#policy-rule-expressions
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/stable/ocata/oslo_policy/_checks.py#L226-L248

In my view, all things considered, to implement RBAC and ABAC based on business rules besides default policy provided in code or in charms there needs to be a simple way to render operator-specified drop-ins.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-28 16:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-28 16:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Changed config.yaml to use an empty dict by default due to the fact that oslo.policy versions prior to 1.25.0 do not handle empty config files properly.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/7c3621dafe2e5a2d98ef9678dbcae8b0ca0abf70'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-01-29 16:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

LGTM - would like gnuoy/thedac to land as charms lead.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-12 11:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-02-12 22:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Dmitrii,

Sorry, I am late to the game on this one. I have two requests. First, please add an explanation to the README as well. Second, this change has zero test coverage. Contexts are notoriously difficult to do as unit tests so you can skip that but an amulet test that sets extra-policy with a value and validates that gets written to disk will go a long way to making sure this functionality is not broken in the future.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]

commit_message:
add support for policy drop-ins via charm config

* oslo.policy allows usage of policy_dirs option (policy.d directory
under config_dir of a service by default);
* by default policy files (yaml or json) are processed and changes from
them override changes in a default policy_file (policy.json);
* policy can potentially come from a subordinate charm, therefore, a
service-specific file name is used for a policy drop-in file;
* file extensions are not used as file contents are interpreted in
oslo.policy regardless of an extension used and any format can be used
in a config option (doesn't depend on policy.json being json)
* extra-policy config option can accept a jinja2 template and it is
possible to use variables available in the keystone context to have an
ability to reference admin_role, admin_domain_id, service_tenant_id etc.

Pulls in charm-helpers changes needed for rendering templates from
strings and EnsureDirContext to make sure a dir exists before a config
is rendered.
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/87 (from_string rendering)
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/88 (policy dir)

NOTE: oslo.policy versions older than 1.25.0 do not handle empty drop-in
files properly, therefore, to clear policy customizations an empty dict
should be used as a content instead of an empty string for this option.
Likewise, an empty dict is used as a default value for this config
option.

Change-Id: I4b82ce2411500e41531a5104bd6853dda62fa3d6
Closes-Bug: #1741723

[{'created': '2018-11-09 14:16:27.000000000', 'message': 'Update devstack pulgin

Currently, monasca-analytics service runs automatically
after devstack/stack.sh.
But, that service continues to run "Alert Fatigue Management" example
using Markov Chain recipe, and it is not expected behavior.

This patch remove unnecessary code and files.

Change-Id: Ia37563c5b213d96f82f3361f33df135fcf5ad41c
'}, {'created': '2018-12-12 12:03:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update devstack plugin

* Current
  After devstack/stack.sh is completed, the monasca-analytics service 
  starts automatically. This service runs "Alert Fatigue Management" 
  example using Markov chain recipe.

* Issue
  This example keep running until kill the process. Therefore, user can
  not manually run the new example process after creating devstack env.

* Solve
  Do not automatically start "Alert Fatigue Management" example. And,
  remove the monasca-analytics service which is no longer necessary.


Change-Id: Ia37563c5b213d96f82f3361f33df135fcf5ad41c
'}]
commit_message:
Update devstack plugin

* Current
  After devstack/stack.sh is completed, the monasca-analytics service 
  starts automatically. This service runs "Alert Fatigue Management" 
  example using Markov chain recipe.

* Issue
  This example keep running until kill the process. Therefore, user can
  not manually run the new example process after creating devstack env.

* Solve
  Do not automatically start "Alert Fatigue Management" example. And,
  remove the monasca-analytics service which is no longer necessary.


Change-Id: Ia37563c5b213d96f82f3361f33df135fcf5ad41c

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Fix auth_url to point at admin endpoint

Fix the auth_url in the service_credentials to the keystone admin
endpoint. This makes is consistent with auth_url in the
keystone_authtoken section.

Change-Id: Ie94ef210d4fd7ae9faf752fab72487b7ebeb4b67

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 935, 'name': 'James Page', 'email': 'james.page@canonical.com', 'username': 'james-page'}, {'_account_id': 6737, 'name': 'Edward Hope-Morley', 'email': 'edward.hope-morley@canonical.com', 'username': 'hopem'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 20635, 'name': 'Ryan Beisner', 'email': 'ryanbeisner@gmail.com', 'username': 'ryan-beisner'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27156, 'name': 'Aydin Doyak', 'email': 'aydin.doyak@canonical.com', 'username': 'aydintd'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-10-30 11:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-10-30 11:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-10-30 11:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Aydin, thanks for submitting this patch. There a couple of issues with your submission that you'll need to address. Firstly your commit message needs to be slightly reformatted in that it should be like:

<short description max 50 chars>

<longer description describing what/why>

Closes-Bug: #<num>

----------------------------------


Secondly i think that this patch might be better placed on the nova-compute charm Readme since that is where it is required if using cinder+ceph. For this charm it might be better to have a more generic explanation of the ceph-access interface and what it is for."}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-10-30 12:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-10-30 12:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-10-30 14:16:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

so just re-iterate what i just discussed with aydin on irc, there are two things to do here:

1. remove the info in this README and move it to nova-compute charm README

2. add some info to this README that explains what the ceph-access interface is for and ref'ing LP 1671422 for contextt"}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-10-30 14:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-10-30 14:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-10-31 09:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I'm going to suggest we fix this in a slightly different way; cinder-ceph knows it needs a relation to nova-compute as of Ocata, so why don't we update the code so that the application will remain in a blocked state until the relation is added and is complete.

That way the charm will tell users they have something wrong, rather than relying on users to read docs."}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-11-13 07:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I absolutely agree. However, I do not have enough skills on charm development yet and maybe someone else should take care of this in the charm code. I also think that we should also keep this commit in the docs in README so we can make sure it's covered in the docs as well."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Aydin, im happy to help just ping me on irc'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-11-14 19:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

I think we should do both:  update required relations, and update the readme(s).

In that case, the "Closes-Bug" in the commit message should be changed to Partial-Bug, and a separate review should be raised to update the required relations for >= Ocata.'}, {'account_id': 27156, 'date': '2017-11-21 15:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-03-12 11:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

Aydin asked if i could take this patch off him so adding to my queue and marking WIP.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.
Feel free to restore it again if you want to pick up and continue the work.'}]

commit_message:
Require ceph-access relation for >= Ocata

Since Ocata the ceph-access interface must be used by
nova-compute in order to be able to attach Ceph volumes
to instances. This commit updates the README file
to include this requirement and also updates the code
to notify users if the interface is not in use for Ocata
and above.

Partial-Bug: #1728570

Change-Id: I4763da7a27baec3bffcef5a5916431e70f532f99

mounted partitions.

closing it.
* Partitions are wiped before zapping
* Zap is done via charmhelpers instead of using the ceph-disk option

All bugs require syncing to relevant charms to actually close

commit_message:
Allow create of osd on mounted devices

Addes logic to create and activate partitions on devices that have
mounted partitions.
* Build ceph-disk flags in function to re-use current logic from
osdize_dev in osdize_part
* Shared osd's implement all options/logic of the osdize_dev
 * Checks for in use
 * Handles the format osd option
 * Works with dmcrypt
 * Will not format/zap non-ceph partitions
 * Will not format/zap mounted ceph partitions

This includes two drive-by fixes for bugs which it didn't make since to
break out. Both changes are in code which was altered in this
patch and not closing them would require implementing the bug to avoid
closing it.
* Partitions are wiped before zapping
* Zap is done as an independent call to ceph-disk

All bugs require syncing to relevant charms to actually close
Partial-Bug: #1743278
Partial-Bug: #1743280
Partial-Bug: #1743282

Change-Id: Id3c8403dfbf710e054ca5e4d965fe6f9b8f9c72b

commit_message:
Add get-status action to the ceph-mon charm

* get-status - outputs ceph -s output

Including unit test for the above action.

(2 comments)

This looks pretty good, and to make sure your code keeps running in the future I would love to see some unit and functional tests added.

Please open a LP bug and add a Closes-Bug reference in the commit message too.

See my in-line comments as well.

Cheers!'}, {'account_id': 21704, 'date': '2017-09-18 02:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-18 02:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

- gate-charm-hacluster-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/55/500655/2/check/gate-charm-hacluster-python27-ubuntu-xenial/5b73bba/ : SUCCESS in 4m 19s
- gate-charm-hacluster-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/55/500655/2/check/gate-charm-hacluster-python35-nv/45ac2b3/ : FAILURE in 2m 48s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 21704, 'date': '2017-09-18 03:06:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This looks pretty good, and to make sure your code keeps running in
 > the future I would love to see some unit and functional tests
 > added.

Is there a good example of how we should be doing this in the openstack charms, and what sort of level of unit & functional testing you want?

 > Please open a LP bug and add a Closes-Bug reference in the commit
 > message too.

Done in patch set 2.

 > See my in-line comments as well.

Done, I moved to using the native xml libraries, I'm not doing anything too fancy with the xml parsing that really needs lxml or BeautifulSoup.

Thanks,
Brad"}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2017-09-21 09:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi Brad,
    Thanks for the mp. For unit tests I don't see any action unit tests for hacluster yet but it should be easy add them following the examples from other OpenStack charms, for example:
https://github.com/openstack/charm-neutron-api/blob/master/unit_tests/test_actions.py . I'd suggest mocking the subprocess call to "crm status xml" so it returns a constant output and check that each action processes that xml correctly.
    For functional tests there are existing amulet tests in the charm which test actions. Given that the existing hacluster amulet tests also deploy a vip I think it should be straight forward to test both of the new actions. (See https://github.com/openstack/charm-hacluster/blob/master/tests/basic_deployment.py#L184 for existing hacluster action functional tests).
Thanks
Liam'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2017-09-21 09:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-09-29 13:38:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503881/"}, {'account_id': 21704, 'date': '2017-11-06 05:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-11-08 05:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

[{'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-11-23 07:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:50:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

While I'm all for adding test coverage, we now have a large proportion of our jobs, and a very large proportion of our CI resources (each ceph job requires 3 VMs) dedicated to ceph.

Perhaps we should drop one of the bluestore jobs and replace it with a filestore job?"}, {'account_id': 11797, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

 > Perhaps we should drop one of the bluestore jobs and replace it
 > with a filestore job?

This is a good idea, we could just make the oracle linux one, for example filestore and leave the rest as bluestore. 

I am wondering, if the default storage is bluestore in Rocky, what is going to happen when people upgrade to Rocky? is our upgrade path leaving their clusters on filestore until they manually upgrade or?'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-11-28 06:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

 > 
 > Perhaps we should drop one of the bluestore jobs and replace it
 > with a filestore job?

Thanks a lot! It is a good idea. I will update the change soon. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-11-28 06:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks a lot for the comments. I will update the change soon.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-11-28 06:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-11-28 07:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just thinking - maybe a better solution is to have one CI job for both bluestore and filestore? We could probably have multiple OSDs for example 1 bluestore + 1 filestore?'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-11-28 08:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Michal,

It is a good idea. I will work along with way and update the patch ASAP. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-11-29 06:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I will update the patch soon.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-12-03 07:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-12-03 10:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-12-04 00:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

http://logs.openstack.org/71/619671/4/check/kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-ceph/02c8ce0/primary/logs/kolla/ceph/ceph_osd_tree.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2018-12-07 14:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 >

 > filestore OSDs?

 > http://logs.openstack.org/71/619671/4/check/kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-ceph/02c8ce0/primary/logs/kolla/ceph/ceph_s.txt.gz
 > http://logs.openstack.org/71/619671/4/check/kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-ceph/02c8ce0/primary/logs/kolla/ceph/ceph_osd_tree.txt.gz

Hi Mark,

Thanks for the comment.

In the patch, two OSD will be created per node, one is bluestore OSD, the other is filestore OSD. 

In the log "ceph_osd_tree.txt.gz", there are total 6 OSD activating.

In the log "ceph_s.txt.gz", all 6 OSD are "up" status. The ceph health is "warning" because the PG number is too small regarding there are 6 OSDs. If we create more Ceph pools, its status will be "OK".

The Ceph cluster status looks correct. 

Thanks.

Br,
Tone'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-07 14:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

> (2 comments)

Hi Eduardo,

I think I met the same issue. The ceph parition creation is part of Zuul tasks, ceph_osd_store_type is defined for ansible. 

Control the partition creation according to the hostname seems the easiest way. What's your opinion?

commit_message:
Add Kolla Ceph filestore CI jobs

Since Rocky bluestore is the default store type used by Kolla Ceph.
Filestore is still used by the customers. The patch allows deploy
both Ceph bluestore OSD and Ceph filestore OSD in Kolla-ansible CI
jobs.

Change-Id: Iaa7c1b2ff35eb649c3a6d9f7266463d8961cdc9e
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

commit_message:
Add show-bcache-devices to ceph osd charm

Show-bcache-devices action lists all the configured bcache disks
on the unit along with the state of all the backing disks

Change-Id: Idf59964ad5e5587f050ba6f9c5ab562e1ca213ba

commit_message:
cleanup: don't update_cache when adding a new repo

We don't need to update_cache when we add a new repo because
we already do it when we install the package in the follow up task.

Change-Id: I1c32655eddee6c37d7433e6aca8be851344e93e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-13 12:16:38.000000000', 'message': 'Adding auth_version=3 parameter if api_version=3

When the cloud is deployed or upgraded with keystone parameter preferred-api-version=3, auth_version=3 parameter should also be set in [keystone_authtoken] section of neutron conf. This is also a requirement for Cisco ACI integration i.e. for cisco group-based-policy plugin to send v3 requests to keystone.

Change-Id: I96c800bf955ad8f52f570b3b6d6fe7a1d521d79a
Closes-Bug: #1702278
'}]
commit_message:
Adding auth_version=3 parameter if api_version=3

When the cloud is deployed or upgraded with keystone parameter preferred-api-version=3, auth_version=3 parameter should also be set in [keystone_authtoken] section of neutron conf. This is also a requirement for Cisco ACI integration i.e. for cisco group-based-policy plugin to send v3 requests to keystone.

Change-Id: I96c800bf955ad8f52f570b3b6d6fe7a1d521d79a
Closes-Bug: #1702278

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

messages:

- gate-charm-swift-proxy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/2/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/c2495f9/ : SUCCESS in 4m 15s
- gate-charm-swift-proxy-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/2/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-python27-ubuntu-xenial/a31a438/ : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- gate-charm-swift-proxy-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/2/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-python35-nv/c99ae5a/ : FAILURE in 2m 39s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 25011, 'date': '2017-09-07 22:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-07 22:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-charm-swift-proxy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/3/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/fef43b5/ : SUCCESS in 4m 22s
- gate-charm-swift-proxy-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/3/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-python27-ubuntu-xenial/19461c1/ : SUCCESS in 5m 14s
- gate-charm-swift-proxy-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/01/499901/3/check/gate-charm-swift-proxy-python35-nv/5da33bb/ : FAILURE in 2m 27s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2017-09-12 18:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thank you for the contribution Drew.

This looks pretty good, and to make sure your code keeps running in the future I would love to see some unit and functional tests added.

Also please open a LP bug and add a Closes-Bug reference in the commit message.

See more comments in-line.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-09-13 23:08:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Hi Drew, this charm already has a 'replicas' config option that, when modified, should result in the rings being updated and redistributed (by the charm). If that is not working properly then let's investigate why not. Also, since this sort of operation is inevitably going to be service interrupting due to the subsequent re-balancing of data. So what's really needed here is (a) to ensure that manipulating these options via charm config actually results in your cluster being updated as expected and (b) that we have best practices (e.g. disabling balancing until we are sure its safe to do). If you'd like I'd be happy to discuss this way you offline to agree on the best way forward."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-09-14 16:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Drew, please see comment in https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1713954 for more info.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-09-29 16:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for your work on this.  In addition to the other reviews, this should have an amulet test to exercise the new action.  Similar to the WIP @:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/494285'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-10-02 11:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just to close the loop on this we now have a spec for extending operational capabilities in the swift charm - https://github.com/openstack/charm-specs/blob/master/specs/queens/approved/swift-extended-cluster-operations.rst. Please ensure that any submissions follow the guidelines set out in that spec.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-28 16:15:03.000000000', 'message': 'Charm lb spec should allow lb to server mulit eps

The charm load balancer spec currently stipulates that a single
load-balancer application should only manage a single endpoint type.
This restriction seems artificial so this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ia6e2a7dba2f7fe270badd3fdb4984399f2049bba
'}]
commit_message:
Charm lb spec should allow lb to server mulit eps

The charm load balancer spec currently stipulates that a single
load-balancer application should only manage a single endpoint type.
This restriction seems artificial so this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ia6e2a7dba2f7fe270badd3fdb4984399f2049bba

I have implemented a new relation ("external-dns") which uses a new interface
("endpoint") between "designate" and "neutron-api" charms.

Once the relation is established, the "designate" charm exposes its internal
API endpoint through relation data. The "neutron-api" charm consumes these
data and updates Neutron configuration files as described here:

https://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/config-dns-int.html

Change-Id: I08df9dbc185877ca82e6bf539b9f56391ead2f35
'}]
commit_message:
Partial-Bug: 1704769

I have implemented a new relation ("external-dns") which uses a new interface
("endpoint") between "designate" and "neutron-api" charms.

Once the relation is established, the "designate" charm exposes its internal
API endpoint through relation data. The "neutron-api" charm consumes these
data and updates Neutron configuration files as described here:

https://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/config-dns-int.html

Change-Id: I08df9dbc185877ca82e6bf539b9f56391ead2f35

'}, {'created': '2017-07-06 15:17:09.000000000', 'message': 'Related-Bug: 1671506

Configure federated authentication, SAML2 and OIDC

This work extends Keystone functionality by configuring federated
authentication leveraging SAML2 Identity Providers and the Google
OpenID Connect Provider.
SAML2 authentication is in widespread use in the world of Research
and Education Networks, with national federations in Europe being
interconnected by eduGAIN (edugain.org).

2017-05-19:  FG;  Completed changes to configure (config.yaml,
	     keystone.conf, keystone_context.py, keystone_utils.py,
	     wsgi-openstack-api.conf and templates) and activate (handful
	     of REST calls in keystone_hooks.py config_postupgrade)
	     support for federated authentication.

	     SAML2 and OIDC parts can be independently configured via
	     enable-saml2 and enable-oidc config.yaml switches, which are
	     both by default set to false, so should not break anything.

	     This charms implements what is in production at GARR
	     cloud, described at:
	     	  https://cloud.garr.it/support/kb/cloud/federated_auth/
	     and corresponds to: cs:~garrcsd/keystone-fed-14

 	     Since this work started, keystone HEAD has moved forward:
	     will tackle this at next commit.

2017-03-10:  FG;  First set of changes to keystone.conf and wsgi-openstack-api
        (which will eventually be dealt with in charm-helpers).

Change-Id: I6bf80e3b23e8219ba6f8b293fb048c97bd75c8ae
Signed-off-by: Fulvio Galeazzi <fulvio.galeazzi@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-09-13 15:29:30.000000000', 'message': 'Related-Bug: 1671506 Configure federated authentication, SAML2 and OIDC

This work extends Keystone functionality by configuring federated
authentication leveraging SAML2 Identity Providers and the Google
OpenID Connect Provider.
SAML2 authentication is in widespread use in the world of Research and
Education Networks, with national federations in Europe being
interconnected by eduGAIN (edugain.org).

Completed changes to configure (config.yaml, keystone.conf,
keystone_context.py, keystone_utils.py, wsgi-openstack-api.conf and
templates) and activate (handful of REST calls in keystone_hooks.py config_postupgrade) support for federated authentication.

SAML2 and OIDC parts can be independently configured via enable-saml2
and enable-oidc config.yaml switches, which are both by default set to
false, so should not break anything.

This charms implements what is in production at GARR cloud, described
at: https://cloud.garr.it/support/kb/cloud/federated_auth/ and
corresponds to: cs:~csd-garr/keystone-fed-4

Signed-off-by: Fulvio Galeazzi <fulvio.galeazzi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Related-Bug: 1671506 Configure federated authentication, SAML2 and OIDC

This work extends Keystone functionality by configuring federated
authentication leveraging SAML2 Identity Providers and the Google
OpenID Connect Provider.
SAML2 authentication is in widespread use in the world of Research and
Education Networks, with national federations in Europe being
interconnected by eduGAIN (edugain.org).

Completed changes to configure (config.yaml, keystone.conf,
keystone_context.py, keystone_utils.py, wsgi-openstack-api.conf and
templates) and activate (handful of REST calls in keystone_hooks.py config_postupgrade) support for federated authentication.

SAML2 and OIDC parts can be independently configured via enable-saml2
and enable-oidc config.yaml switches, which are both by default set to
false, so should not break anything.

This charms implements what is in production at GARR cloud, described
at: https://cloud.garr.it/support/kb/cloud/federated_auth/ and
corresponds to: cs:~csd-garr/keystone-fed-4

Change-Id: I6bf80e3b23e8219ba6f8b293fb048c97bd75c8ae
Signed-off-by: Fulvio Galeazzi <fulvio.galeazzi@gmail.com>

Thanks for the feature patch.  Looks good (a few problems), and not entirely sure this is a "complete" feature (see reverse lookup config in the section-designate).'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2017-08-30 02:32:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

(5 comments)

Thanks for the patchset! I too would like to see external dns integration enabled. In addition to Alex's comments, I've got a few additional inline comments that need to be addressed.

Additionally, since this involves a new relation interface that should be managed under the OpenStack Charm space I think this would benefit from having a spec created (https://github.com/openstack/charm-specs), repos created according to the OpenStack Project Creator's Guide (https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html), and a launchpad project under https://launchpad.net/openstack-charms as well to track any future bugs against it.

Perhaps we can open up the queens cycle by proposing a spec. Feel free to ping me (wolsen) or any of the other openstack-charmers on IRC if you need assistance with that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-12 23:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Partial-Bug: 1704769

I have implemented a new relation ("external-dns") which uses a new interface
("endpoint") between "designate" and "neutron-api" charms.

Once the relation is established, the "designate" charm exposes its internal
API endpoint through relation data. The "neutron-api" charm consumes these
data and updates Neutron configuration files as described here:

https://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/config-dns-int.html

Change-Id: Ic917e2937719998c934d1f9c85637df61e4699fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-21 08:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Adds support for overriding policy.json in ocata

In OpenStack deployments using external RBAC more fine-grained
control of policy can be desireable. This PR adds a config option
to pass a base64 encoded string representing a custom policy.json
into the charm in ocata and higher. If this config option is
present the string is decoded and passed into the existing template
as a total override of its contents. This obviously allows users
to shoot themselves in the foot, but unsetting the config option
will revert the policy to its original state following a
config-changed hook.

Change-Id: I982aa4f410bbcf24ab33dcc049ba07d5c0eceb75
'}, {'created': '2017-07-21 12:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Adds support for overriding policy.json in ocata

control of policy can be desireable. This PR adds a config option
to pass a base64 encoded string representing a custom policy.json
template into the charm. If this config option is present the
string is decoded and rendered out to a location on disk.
In conjunction with a change to how
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.templating.py operates allows the
decoded template to be selected. This obviously allows users
to shoot themselves in the foot, but unsetting the config option
will revert the policy to its original state following a
config-changed hook.

Change-Id: I982aa4f410bbcf24ab33dcc049ba07d5c0eceb75
'}, {'created': '2017-09-06 14:14:17.000000000', 'message': 'Adds support for overriding policy.json in ocata

template into the charm. If this config option is present the
string is decoded and rendered out to a location on disk.
In conjunction with a change to how
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.templating.py operates allows the
decoded template to be selected. This obviously allows users
to shoot themselves in the foot, but unsetting the config option
will revert the policy to its original state following a
config-changed hook.

Change-Id: I982aa4f410bbcf24ab33dcc049ba07d5c0eceb75
'}]
commit_message:
Adds support for overriding policy.json in ocata

In OpenStack deployments using external RBAC more fine-grained
control of policy can be desireable. This PR adds a config option
to pass a base64 encoded string representing a custom policy.json
template into the charm. If this config option is present the
string is decoded and rendered out to a location on disk.
In conjunction with a change to how
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.templating.py operates allows the
decoded template to be selected. This obviously allows users
to shoot themselves in the foot, but unsetting the config option
will revert the policy to its original state following a
config-changed hook.

Change-Id: I982aa4f410bbcf24ab33dcc049ba07d5c0eceb75

commit_message:
Replaced uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I1eca0a509601de536c5c5f5879f8dc6fd8b4e6d7

commit_message:
Add support of an optional journal zapping config.

Add a new boolean config option "zap-journals" to be able to activate or
desactivate journal zapping when deploying ceph-osd charm. The default
value for this option is "True".
Problem: To migrate an existing node into a Juju managed Ceph cluster,
the journal always gets zapped if it is on an external disk. This will
cause the loss of the OSD.

Closes-Bug: #1637003

Change-Id: I9f2dfd4c2ceda0e6e486792a39cbcdcd67d4a8dd
