commit_message:
Allow using a newer etcd package than in the Ubuntu archive

This is motivated by the problem reported at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/etcd/+bug/1620897.  The
current etcd in Xenial has a serious problem with its proxy function,
and I need a way for a current customer deployment to be able to use a
newer (and fixed!) etcd package, until that problem is fixed in the
Xenial archive.

Change-Id: Icbc0dfea9ebc06c05616e2d1c6a85f93af4e4428

commit_message:
Test upgrading seed services in CI

Adds the kayobe-seed-upgrade-centos job, which performs an upgrade of
the seed services from the previous release to the current release.

Change-Id: Ia3eb39cf81cb3618fd94c4456bd576b52098c946
Story: 2004308
Task: 27873
(cherry picked from commit 390af7a06b321368776f8a5d005f27ad0928d37e)

commit_message:
Added support for installing python-tempestconf from git

In CI jobs, currently python-tempestconf is getting from pip,
which makes it hard to test dependent changes of the project.
By adding this support, one can test the python-tempestconf
changes in the review itself.

Setting tempest_developer_mode to true will exercise the same.

Change-Id: I7744270e7371260dcc4db146736710fb050f3502

services restart. We did it after Newton when we switched the services

With containers, we don't want / need that anymore.
In Pike, Queens and Rocky, containers are restarted by the Docker
Engine.
In Stein, containers are restarted by Systemd (which restart podman
containers) but the unit files are now managed by Paunch.

To avoid weird behaviors, let's clean this up.

commit_message:
Prevent systemd unit files to be created to restart services

This patch removes the code that create/modify Systemd unit files so the
services restart. We did it after Newton when we switched the services
to be managed under Systemd to automatically restart.

With containers, we don't want / need that anymore.
In Pike, Queens and Rocky, containers are restarted by the Docker
Engine.
In Stein, containers are restarted by Systemd (which restart podman
containers) but the unit files are now managed by Paunch.

To avoid weird behaviors, let's clean this up.

Change-Id: I82dca36b3c9ebf4243d270ac91ffbf6ad56d6ca6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 12:59:18.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent service bootstrap node facts from colliding with each other

Many services currently set an `is_bootstrap_node` fact, meaning they
override each other's results when the fact is being set. As long as
the fact doesn't belong into a particular step but it's executed on
every step, nothing bad happens, as the correct is_bootstrap_node
setting directly precedes any service upgrade tasks. However, we
intend to put the fact setting into step 0 in change
Ib04b051e8f4275e06be0cafa81e2111c9cced9b7 and at that point the name
collision would break upgrades (only one service would "win" in
setting the is_bootstrap_node fact).

This patch changes the is_bootstrap_node facts in upgrade_tasks to use
per-service naming.

Note that fast_forward_upgrade_tasks use their own is_boostrap_node
logic provided by the FFU framework itself, so there we keep the
is_boostrap_node fact. It's not guaranteed that this is the correct
behavior for all circumstances, but if we want to change how the FFU
framework approaches bootstrap logic, we should do so in a separate
patch.

Change-Id: I9c585d3cb282b7e4eb0bacb3cf6909e04a9a495e
Closes-Bug: #1810408
'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 13:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent service bootstrap node facts from colliding with each other

Many services currently set an `is_bootstrap_node` fact, meaning they
override each other's results when the fact is being set. As long as
the fact doesn't belong into a particular step but it's executed on
every step, nothing bad happens, as the correct is_bootstrap_node
setting directly precedes any service upgrade tasks. However, we
intend to put the fact setting into step 0 in change
Ib04b051e8f4275e06be0cafa81e2111c9cced9b7 and at that point the name
collision would break upgrades (only one service would "win" in
setting the is_bootstrap_node fact).

This patch changes the is_bootstrap_node facts in upgrade_tasks to use
per-service naming.

Note that fast_forward_upgrade_tasks use their own is_boostrap_node
logic. We've uncovered some weirdness there while looking into the
is_boostrap_node issue, but the fix is not a low hanging fruit and
likely we'll be completely redoing the FFU tasks for Q->T
upgrade. So the FFU tasks are left alone for now.

Change-Id: I9c585d3cb282b7e4eb0bacb3cf6909e04a9a495e
Closes-Bug: #1810408
'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 13:28:38.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent service bootstrap node facts from colliding with each other

commit_message:
Prevent service bootstrap node facts from colliding with each other

Many services currently set an `is_bootstrap_node` fact, meaning they
override each other's results when the fact is being set. As long as
the fact doesn't belong into a particular step but it's executed on
every step, nothing bad happens, as the correct is_bootstrap_node
setting directly precedes any service upgrade tasks. However, we
intend to put the fact setting into step 0 in change
Ib04b051e8f4275e06be0cafa81e2111c9cced9b7 and at that point the name
collision would break upgrades (only one service would "win" in
setting the is_bootstrap_node fact).

This patch changes the is_bootstrap_node facts in upgrade_tasks to use
per-service naming.

Note that fast_forward_upgrade_tasks use their own is_boostrap_node
logic. We've uncovered some weirdness there while looking into the
is_boostrap_node issue, but the fix is not a low hanging fruit and
likely we'll be completely redoing the FFU tasks for Q->T
upgrade. So the FFU tasks are left alone for now.

Change-Id: I9c585d3cb282b7e4eb0bacb3cf6909e04a9a495e
Closes-Bug: #1810408

subject: Generate PTGbot index page dynamically
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-21 14:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2019-01-04 09:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-07 10:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 14:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Generate PTGbot index page dynamically

Current system (where the index page is specified in the
puppet-ptgbot module) requires that (some) links on the page
are updated in puppet-ptgbot at the start of every event.

That page should be dynamically generated from JSON data.
That way the list of links can be provided in the JSON database
and dynamically imported and updated using the ~fetchdb command.

Change-Id: I7d82b38cba495e5837ba54fbe7a9b7e9c8e14259
'}]
commit_message:
Generate PTGbot index page dynamically

Current system (where the index page is specified in the
puppet-ptgbot module) requires that (some) links on the page
are updated in puppet-ptgbot at the start of every event.

That page should be dynamically generated from JSON data.
That way the list of links can be provided in the JSON database
and dynamically imported and updated using the ~fetchdb command.

Change-Id: I7d82b38cba495e5837ba54fbe7a9b7e9c8e14259

[{'created': '2018-12-21 14:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Pin irc module to 15.1.1 to avoid import error

ib3 triggers an irc.buffer import failure when used with
irc>=16. The fix is in[1], but was not released yet. In
the meantime, pin irc module to 15.1.1 to work around the
issue.

[1] https://github.com/bd808/python-ib3/commit/92da70155e5378478802cb38baaa2a00187201d6

Change-Id: I6353185daa4a494d81ce519a2498639a4f973212
'}]
commit_message:
Pin irc module to 15.1.1 to avoid import error

ib3 triggers an irc.buffer import failure when used with
irc>=16. The fix is in[1], but was not released yet. In
the meantime, pin irc module to 15.1.1 to work around the
issue.

[1] https://github.com/bd808/python-ib3/commit/92da70155e5378478802cb38baaa2a00187201d6

Change-Id: I6353185daa4a494d81ce519a2498639a4f973212

This commit appears to break XenServer integration.

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/05a54e800430bcfc81e36e1dad89fa47f3e8a6f0#diff-6a3c59b7b71c12cc29eca4c85268864eR1348 appears to run exclusively in the context of Nova - however in XenServer, the IP address for the tunnel is in dom0.
We therefore fail with ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [-] Tunneling can't be enabled with invalid local_ip '10.62.65.37'. IP couldn't be found on this host's interfaces.

Raised as https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1810764"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 03:43:20.000000000', 'message': "Allow non-deterministic ``local_gb`` property

Failure to detect ``local_gb`` makes the Redfish inspection fail.
But ideally it shouldn't fail, for instance the node can be a
disk-less node.

Allow Redfish inspect operation now to ignore missing ``local_gb``
property and sets it to '0' in such scenario.

Change-Id: I96fa83b81372333e626cca0e64fefcd0aeabe031
Story: 2004622
Task: 28542
"}, {'created': '2019-01-04 06:01:24.000000000', 'message': "Allow missing ``local_gb`` property

Failure to detect ``local_gb`` fails the Redfish inspection.
But ideally it shouldn't fail, for instance the node can be a
disk-less node.

Allow Redfish inspect operation now to ignore missing ``local_gb``
property and set it to 0 in such cases.

Change-Id: I96fa83b81372333e626cca0e64fefcd0aeabe031
Story: 2004622
Task: 28542
"}]
commit_message:
Allow missing ``local_gb`` property

Failure to detect ``local_gb`` fails the Redfish inspection.
But ideally it shouldn't fail, for instance the node can be a
disk-less node.

Allow Redfish inspect operation now to ignore missing ``local_gb``
property and set it to 0 in such cases.

Change-Id: I96fa83b81372333e626cca0e64fefcd0aeabe031
Story: 2004622
Task: 28542

commit_message:
Add missing JS source

cloudkitty-dashboard, so far, doesn't have sourcefull versions of JS files.
This makes the whole package non-free.

This is also quite dangerous, because there's no way to track version
of included javascript, leading to potential security hole disaster.

First step is to re-add the source file. Next step will probably be to
use XStatic packages.

This patch partially addresses:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003578

but cannot claim to actually fix it. The proper fix would be XStatic.

Story: 2003578
Task: 24924
Change-Id: I02738e95a04bfb497c3bcc99fc7d4765bf23a67d

commit_message:
Changed the message level for deleting some resources to info

Added functionality to the handle function in the BatchAction class
in action.py and allowed the easy changing between the alert types
and made deleting images, instances, and volumes give an info alert
rather than a success message and altered the testing parameters

Change-Id: I93251d6d12cf89a331b5c051bf4fe10a6e470f51
Closes-Bug: #1291681

commit_message:
Chef 14 stable release updates and fixes

This change corrects some of the issues with resource naming[1] as well
as prunes some failing unit tests that would be obsoleted with the changes
in the service renaming[2].

[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:chef_14_fixes+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

commit_message:
Add missing role_specific tag for NUMA aware vswitches params

Change I318ba9c262f64c0d416a017ed836ae0729acedb4 expose NUMA
aware vswitches configuration parameter, which are role-specific.

The proposed patch adds role_specific tag for those parameters
which is missed in original patch.

Change-Id: I96fd7dfc5468bf1dbdc665b3d848b40223ee9454
(cherry picked from commit 90717bdca62ef7408958942efec85c89202a939c)

subject: Destroy VMs instead of shutting down during save
messages:
[{'account_id': 290, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For some context running an older version of mysql, it appears that the gvwstate.dat is removed on a normal shutdown causing prepare-image-galera.sh to fail.  The other solution could be to do a killall -9 mysqld on all infra_hosts so that the gvwstate.dat files remain during the image capture.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-21 17:01:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'd rather that we catered to this possibility in the image restore process - the bash script could detect the missing file and then do something appropriate (not sure what that is).

Did this happen with a particular version of MariaDB?"}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I was testing capturing a 13.3.12 build of OSA which was running:

mariadb-galera-server-10.0:amd64 (10.0.37+maria-1~trusty)
xtrabackup:amd64 (2.3.10-1.trusty)

By just doing a /etc/init.d/mysql stop, the file is immediately removed.  Found some stuff related to that state file too:

https://www.percona.com/blog/2014/12/03/auto-bootstrapping-an-all-down-cluster-with-percona-xtradb-cluster/'}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2019-01-03 00:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-01-07 09:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI https://review.openstack.org/624687 was added to handle the situation where there is no gvwstate.dat file.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 15:52:53.000000000', 'message': 'Destroy VMs instead of shutting down during save

With a regular shutdown, in some cases it appears MariaDB will remove
the gvwstate.dat as part of the shutdown.  In order to capture that file
to rebuild the cluster, turn off the VM instead of shutting down.

Change-Id: I907d57ffc841e98412ccce95713cb18c4a02c7d3
'}]
commit_message:
Destroy VMs instead of shutting down during save

With a regular shutdown, in some cases it appears MariaDB will remove
the gvwstate.dat as part of the shutdown.  In order to capture that file
to rebuild the cluster, turn off the VM instead of shutting down.

Change-Id: I907d57ffc841e98412ccce95713cb18c4a02c7d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 08:26:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic inspector dnsmasq listening interface

The variable 'ironic_dnsmasq_interface' is used to configure the interface
used by the ironic inspector dnsmasq service for DHCP on the inspection
network. It is being used correctly in inspector.conf, but not in the
dnsmasq configuration file, which uses api_interface. This change modifies
the dnsmasq configuration file to also use ironic_dnsmasq_interface.

Change-Id: I7670544f4bc41c93ac1d081486502f9ffb8f2286
Closes-Bug: #1785574
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector dnsmasq listening interface

The variable 'ironic_dnsmasq_interface' is used to configure the interface
used by the ironic inspector dnsmasq service for DHCP on the inspection
network. It is being used correctly in inspector.conf, but not in the
dnsmasq configuration file, which uses api_interface. This change modifies
the dnsmasq configuration file to also use ironic_dnsmasq_interface.

Change-Id: I7670544f4bc41c93ac1d081486502f9ffb8f2286
Closes-Bug: #1785574

Yes Ceph packages are there in Fedora itself so they don't need to enable additional repos, if i got ur point correctly u are saying ceph::repo::ensure=absent for Fedora else true, right?"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Do not enable Ceph el7 repos for Fedora

Fedora Base repo includes ceph packages, so
no extra repo required as the packages in Fedora
repo conflicts with el7 repo.

The ceph packages are also being added to fedora
stable-base([1]) consumed in Fedora Testing.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/17650/

Change-Id: I1f1e8461cf49c680de2630396cdec5ff5774f0ec

[{'created': '2019-01-03 14:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure we get the right SELinux context for config-data sub-dir

When docker was used, its "create host directory tree" feature was
used. It apparently created directories with "container_var_lib_t"
type, and this prevents podman container to access the content with
AVC errors (permission denied).

The following patch ensures we get a recursive chcon running.

We're using "command" instead of "file" module because ansible doesn't
like broken symlink (in fact, they are symlink with relative path
within containers).

Change-Id: I20d00c79fc898b0c4e535662ee6a70472e075b36
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure we get the right SELinux context for config-data sub-dir

When docker was used, its "create host directory tree" feature was
used. It apparently created directories with "container_var_lib_t"
type, and this prevents podman container to access the content with
AVC errors (permission denied).

The following patch ensures we get a recursive chcon running.

We're using "command" instead of "file" module because ansible doesn't
like broken symlink (in fact, they are symlink with relative path
within containers).

Change-Id: I20d00c79fc898b0c4e535662ee6a70472e075b36

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 06:43:46.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add tempest last command

Once Tempest run finishes, User wants to generate subunit stream
in v2 format from the last run. Currently when we use tempest run
--subunit it always returns 0 as exit status irrespective of the
test failures as it is the known behavior of stestr run --subunit
which confuses users whether last tempest run was successful.
tempest last --subunit will solve this issue and will be useful
for users.

[1.] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues/210

Change-Id: I8ef691da35aa7ad570d78b1f795f622443665fbc
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add tempest last command

Once Tempest run finishes, User wants to generate subunit stream
in v2 format from the last run. Currently when we use tempest run
--subunit it always returns 0 as exit status irrespective of the
test failures as it is the known behavior of stestr run --subunit
which confuses users whether last tempest run was successful.
tempest last --subunit will solve this issue and will be useful
for users.

[1.] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues/210

Change-Id: I8ef691da35aa7ad570d78b1f795f622443665fbc

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

Also, update some minimal requirement for horizon
needs newer versions. This is needed to pass the lower-constraints
job.

Change-Id: I6d69299c6099bdcd3671e7e7c764604676e8eaef
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/623229

commit_message:
Support deploy of Swift with internal S3 support

Swift support is in-tree for Swift since OpenStack Rocky, and
the swift-plugin-s3 package has been removed from the archive at
Cosmic so drop installation at Rocky.

Add new template for Rocky to use the in-tree s3api and s3token
middleware.

Enable cosmic test to validate changes.

Change-Id: Ie5447dc44203c1ea2ad27e6d71248ba59d7549d0
Closes-Bug: 1805597

[{'created': '2018-11-08 23:51:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix check-run-nova-compute script shebang

For python3 packaging we are looking for /usr/bin/env python to swap out
with the python3 binary in the packaging. Rather than look for
/usr/bin/python, it's easier to use /usr/bin/env python since the other
files have this. Update this script for consistency.

Change-Id: I3606c356a2103ce1e26e78e1192f0713b51e1ca4
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
"}]
commit_message:
Fix check-run-nova-compute script shebang

For python3 packaging we are looking for /usr/bin/env python to swap out
with the python3 binary in the packaging. Rather than look for
/usr/bin/python, it's easier to use /usr/bin/env python since the other
files have this. Update this script for consistency.

Change-Id: I3606c356a2103ce1e26e78e1192f0713b51e1ca4
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

messages:
[{'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-01-03 13:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-01-03 13:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maciej, I apologize to you. I was wrong.

The _gather_port_ids_and_networks() function actually is *not* only returning cached network information :(

It's actually *merging* the cached network info (or network ports information) with the network (or ports) parameters that are passed to the function. :(

This is a terrible interface and the fact that the docstring doesn't describe what the function does makes it all the worse.

Mea culpa. Can you please scrap this patch and revert the function name back to its original?

Sorry about this :(

-jay"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-01-03 14:00:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Maciej, I apologize to you. I was wrong.
 > 
 > The _gather_port_ids_and_networks() function actually is *not* only
 > returning cached network information :(
 > 
 > It's actually *merging* the cached network info (or network ports
 > information) with the network (or ports) parameters that are passed
 > to the function. :(
 > 
 > This is a terrible interface and the fact that the docstring
 > doesn't describe what the function does makes it all the worse.
 > 
 > Mea culpa. Can you please scrap this patch and revert the function
 > name back to its original?
 > 
 > Sorry about this :(
 > 
 > -jay

Roger that :)"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/628175/1 : FAILURE in 2h 19m 50s'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-01-07 07:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 13:28:42.000000000', 'message': 'Rename method _gather_port_ids_and_networks to _get_cached_network_info

The _gather_port_ids_and_networks method returns data based on
data stored in InstanceInfoCaches object.
We should differentiate it from other methods that base on
Neutron point of view.

Change-Id: I1614eae02d62aeab6936932bcdb15e893afa21aa
'}]
commit_message:
Rename method _gather_port_ids_and_networks to _get_cached_network_info

The _gather_port_ids_and_networks method returns data based on
data stored in InstanceInfoCaches object.
We should differentiate it from other methods that base on
Neutron point of view.

Change-Id: I1614eae02d62aeab6936932bcdb15e893afa21aa

(1 comment)

Thanks Julia and Dmitry for having a look. I am just back from year-end mini holiday and have gradually started to look into the pile of works.

> I think the existing OOB inspection implementation does fail when local_gb cannot be determined, but I have to look at the code to confirm.

Yes Dmitry, the existing OOB Redfish inspection does fail when local_gb cannot be determined (Refer this code section [1]). But as Julia mentioned, this code got in only on the development branch of Ironic and was not there till Rocky. Let me know if you still want me to split these into three separate patches; I am completely fine either way.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/inspect.py#L162-L176'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:57:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Splitting patches is not only about stable branches, but also for reviewer's sanity :) I'd still appreciate that."}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have raised 3 separate patches:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628095/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628096/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628097/'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-07 07:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

As this has been split into 3 separate patches and raised and tracked over there!'}]

commit_message:
Fixing Redfish inspection

Redfish inspect operation now ignores missing ``local_gb`` property.
Failure to detect ``local_gb`` should not make the inspection fail,
for instance it can be a disk-less node. Other bug fixes are:

  - Properly namespaces SushyError exception.
  - Replaces ``eth_summary`` with ``summary`` attribute on
    ethernet_interfaces.

Introduces a new helper method, named
``create_ports_for_enabled_macs_if_not_exist`` in inspect_utils
module to handle Sushy returned ethernet summary results.

Story: 2004622
Task: 28542

Story: 2004560
Task: 28543

Story: 2004638
Task: 28574

Change-Id: I2f20f13c9b3d92962db808fb8f1ffa2840f42334

commit_message:
Add fedora support to tripleo-repos

For Stein we are working on tripleo support as part of the python3 code.
In order to assist in the development, tripleo-repos should allow for
fedora to be passed into the command.

Change-Id: I23df8f6fe68ba47c92bdb3c031de44b47b1a16e2
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

subject: Update requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Currently, "zuul check" are failed, but, this is within my expectations.

I'll try to submit some patches.
My plan is follows:

1. Submit some patches for openstack/reqirements to pass the "requirements-check".
2. Update devstack patch[1] to pass the "openstack-tox-py27".
3. Update unit tests for python3.5, and update zuul job "openstack-tox-py35(non-voting)" to "openstack-tox-py35".

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595545/'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-11-05 14:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Apparently Python 2 unit tests fail with the new `scikit-learn` library. Please start with fixing these.'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2018-11-07 03:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2018-11-07 04:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the patch :-)

I checked the log from requirements-check, the following packages are the reason of the error.
- docopt
- tornado
- numpy
As for docopt and tornade, it seems we only use few steps
so it's better to re-write code for not using them.
As for numpy, it's better to post a patch to base.
What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-11-07 06:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Witold, @Hisashi, 
Thank you for your reviews.

I updated Python 2 unit tests.
Currently, openstack-tox-py27 job is SUCCESS status.

- docopt 
docopt is only used to parse arguments in run.py.
I'll update run.py without docopt in this patch.

- tornado
It seems to use tornado only few steps, but Banana(a configuration language for monasca-analytics) code is based on tornado.
I think tornado is a necessary package."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-11-07 08:52:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> - tornado
 > It seems to use tornado only few steps, but Banana(a configuration
 > language for monasca-analytics) code is based on tornado.
 > I think tornado is a necessary package.

If it's necessary I see two options:

1. Try to add it to global-requirements in openstack/requirements repo. Please check the review criteria [1] for the information you should provide.

2. Remove requirements-check job.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#for-new-requirements"}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-11-07 08:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please enable test coverage job in another change. This reference might help [1].
Do you have some functional and/or integration tests which you could run in CI?

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html#coverage-jobs'}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-12-27 11:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-12-27 12:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Witold, @Hisashi, 

I updated this patch as follows.

- Use "argparse" which is one of the Python Standard Library instead of "docopt"
- Choose 2nd option suggested by @Witold 

> 2. Remove requirements-check job.


but, Zuul check is failed. I'll try to update again...'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2019-01-07 04:13:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the update. I think this patch has a conflict with #627757. It's better to merge these two patches into a patch. After that you can post it without error.

BTW: I understand we remove this requirement-check now but I think we should re-install the check after replacing tornade to another one."}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2019-01-07 05:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2019-01-07 05:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks, Daisuke!
One comment: I believe removing requirement-check job is tentative approach. So we should replace tornade to flask in near future.'}]

This patch includes the following updates.

- Remove "findspark" and "libpgm" packages.
    There are no longer in use.

- Rename "sklearn" to "scikit-learn".
    "global-reqirements" needs "scikit-learn" instead of "sklearn" which is old package name.

- Pin scipy version less than 1.2.0.
    Currently, according to upper-constraints.txt of openstack/requirements, scipy version is '1.2.0'.
    However, this scipy version seems to be unable to import and use some scikit-learn libraries.

    "docopt" is not used in OpenStack.

- Remove requirements-check job.
    Currently, "tornado" is a required package, but requirements-check job has a error.
    However, to remove that error, adding "tornado" package to openstack/requirements was refused.

Change-Id: I3bb98ef733ff16558d241968b06c31fa7508d047
'}]
commit_message:
Update requirements

This patch includes the following updates.

- Remove "findspark" and "libpgm" packages.
    There are no longer in use.

- Rename "sklearn" to "scikit-learn".
    "global-reqirements" needs "scikit-learn" instead of "sklearn" which is old package name.

- Pin scipy version less than 1.2.0.
    Currently, according to upper-constraints.txt of openstack/requirements, scipy version is '1.2.0'.
    However, this scipy version seems to be unable to import and use some scikit-learn libraries.

- Remove "docopt" and re-wite code wihtout "docopt".
    "docopt" is not used in OpenStack.

- Remove requirements-check job.
    Currently, "tornado" is a required package, but requirements-check job has a error.
    However, to remove that error, adding "tornado" package to openstack/requirements was refused.

Change-Id: I3bb98ef733ff16558d241968b06c31fa7508d047

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I718bc2b9db7f2199369e1d85ddb49ebd9774439d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pin scipy version less than 1.2.0

Currently, according to upper-constraints.txt of openstack/requirements,
scipy version is '1.2.0'.

However, this scipy version seems to be unable to import and use some scikit-learn libraries.
Therefore, openstack-tox-py27 of Zuul check has failed.

Change-Id: Ida186d3a556bbe58d1806cd50a60b90b3a8344d8

commit_message:
Remove duplicate RBAC logging from enforcer

A recent change to oslo.policy allowed RBAC enforcement data to be
logged there, making it more reusable and consistent for other
services using oslo.policy:

  I4642c57990b145c0e691140970574412682e66a5

This commit removes keystone-specific code for debug logging the same
information.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18546, 'date': '2019-01-03 10:43:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Hi, I noticed that we ensured mac address is unique in one request: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510830  ,but I didn't find the check for the ports that are created previously in the same network, shall we add the check here?"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-01-03 18:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> Hi, I noticed that we ensured mac address is unique in one request:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510830  ,but I didn't find the
 > check for the ports that are created previously in the same
 > network, shall we add the check here?

I am not sure I understand.  Are you worried that a user might send a bulk port request containing MAC addresses that are already in use by existing ports?"}, {'account_id': 18546, 'date': '2019-01-04 04:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Yes, say we are bulk creating ports on a network that already has a port with mac_address_1, and we cannot ensure that the already used mac_address_1 will not be generated and used again here.
I mean maybe we need to check this case or is it checked elsewhere?'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-01-04 20:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> Yes, say we are bulk creating ports on a network that already has a
 > port with mac_address_1, and we cannot ensure that the already used
 > mac_address_1 will not be generated and used again here.
 > I mean maybe we need to check this case or is it checked elsewhere?

I believe that is handled by the uniqueness constraint at the database level that requires the combination of network id and mac address to be unique [1].  Reusing mac addresses on separate networks is permitted IIUC.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/db/models_v2.py#n107'}, {'account_id': 18546, 'date': '2019-01-07 03:47:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Yes you are right! I missed that since I'm tuning an outdated version of openstack. Thanks for pointing that out!"}]

commit_message:
Add bulk port creation of DB objects

Implement a new function called create_port_obj_bulk that optimizes
bulk port creation operations by streamlining ensuring network existence
and operates on an array of port data.

Change-Id: Ie819c215944514d0bb43c2ce87394825bda41e94
Partially-Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation

messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 7daa3bdbf35f1f2305b585d4d28370cc5b388316'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-28 17:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Clean backport. Fixes a bug.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 14:14:23.000000000', 'message': "Ignore errors in purging events

There is a known issue with purging the resource properties data for events
where the same resource properties data is referenced by a resource or
event in the backup stack.

It's more important that we are able to store a new event than that we are
able to purge old events, so catch any exceptions in purging and log an
error, rather than allowing the exception to abort the event creation.

Also use a transaction to ensure that we roll back the deletion of the
events when we encounter an error. This ensures that any resource
properties data *not* referenced by the backup stack is not orphaned
because of failures deleting other rows. This will allow us to properly
purge the database once the issue is fixed.

Change-Id: Iefa706f91382f7d1c47e09e8f67a9fad53a9390b
Story: #2002643
Task: 22334
(cherry picked from commit 6169ed4660232871c8e47690257612a363bc88d3)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore errors in purging events

There is a known issue with purging the resource properties data for events
where the same resource properties data is referenced by a resource or
event in the backup stack.

It's more important that we are able to store a new event than that we are
able to purge old events, so catch any exceptions in purging and log an
error, rather than allowing the exception to abort the event creation.

Also use a transaction to ensure that we roll back the deletion of the
events when we encounter an error. This ensures that any resource
properties data *not* referenced by the backup stack is not orphaned
because of failures deleting other rows. This will allow us to properly
purge the database once the issue is fixed.

Change-Id: Iefa706f91382f7d1c47e09e8f67a9fad53a9390b
Story: #2002643
Task: 22334
(cherry picked from commit 6169ed4660232871c8e47690257612a363bc88d3)

commit_message:
Implement a upgrade check for 'numactl'

After the implementation of the cpu pinning feature [1], the program
'numactl' must exist. This commit implements a upgrade check for
existence of this binary.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617928/

Change-Id: I255556fbff1b2303de2b41648538f7ec3871f1ba

commit_message:
Make multinode job voting

The multinode job is useful for catching issues on multinode
environment and this commit promote this job to voting.

In order to make the job success, this commit also fixes
two issues:
* Fix the nodeset of compute node (it should be 'subnode' instead
  of 'peers').
* Don't perform API-related configuration in compute node.

Change-Id: I16833dca7f442e5700a84dca042f04fb0edf25c7

with registry on pulling docker images.

commit_message:
Add support for default registry

In before, if users don't specify the registry in image name
(i.e. 'zun run coreos/etcd' instead of 'zun run quay.io/coreos/etcd').
Zun will pull image from the default registry which is 'docker.io'.
This commit makes the default registry configurable. As a result,
operators can specify a default registry.

For example, the config file can be set as following:

  [docker]
  default_registry = quay.io
  ...

Then, if users run a container like:

  $ zun run coreos/etcd

Zun will pull the image from 'quay.io/coreos/etcd'

Change-Id: I797afadef1e2ebd9d198baf308bcecca973e0b0d

When we parse the docker image name, the hostname component
must contain '.' or ':' unless it is 'localhost'.

[{'created': '2018-12-30 20:01:06.000000000', 'message': "Use samltest.id as an example sandbox IdP

The federation documentation inconsistently references samltest.id
(formerly testshib.org, which is not well maintained) or a keystone IdP
(before keystone-to-keystone is introduced). This change switches the
examples to use samltest.id[1] and renames 'myidp' to 'samltest' where
appropriate. In the case of the WebSSO horizon configuration examples,
it's not appropriate to switch the openid examples to samltest because

that you can pair different protocols to a single IdP, so use 'acme' as
the example.

[1] https://samltest.id

commit_message:
Use samltest.id as an example sandbox IdP

The federation documentation inconsistently references samltest.id
(formerly testshib.org, which is not well maintained) or a keystone IdP
(before keystone-to-keystone is introduced). This change switches the
examples to use samltest.id[1] and renames 'myidp' to 'samltest' where
appropriate. In the case of the WebSSO horizon configuration examples,
it's not appropriate to switch the openid examples to samltest because
samltest.id does not support OpenIDC. The examples are meant to show
that you can pair different protocols to a single IdP, so use 'acme' as
the example.

[1] https://samltest.id

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I2633ba460182ed8ed5195a10cdaae663add8b1aa

commit_message:
Fix nits in code blocks in federation guide

Fix inconsistent indentation of code-blocks, ensure shell samples
correctly differentiate betweeen root-required commands and non-root
commands in accordance with the openstack-manuals recommendations[1],
and use proper markup for interactive shell examples.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-manuals/tree/doc/common/conventions.rst

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: Ia9e5280d131e1aa50af41aff6155eb07954b7d15

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-30 20:01:06.000000000', 'message': "Bring SP/IdP URLs closer to style guide guidance

The documentation style guide recommends using example URLs for
OpenStack services that look like
`http://<service>.openstack.example.org`. This patch changes the URLs
for hypothetical keystone Service Providers to use HTTPS endpoints to
set a good example of security, to use the example.org domain instead of
localhost or example.com, to include keystone in the name for clarity of
what the service is, and to use a consistent URL path and port. It
doesn't include 'openstack' in the domain name because that becomes a
bit long.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/urls.html

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I8e12edaa589be3c8e71b10d0609c057fd2bfb247
"}]
commit_message:
Bring SP/IdP URLs closer to style guide guidance

The documentation style guide recommends using example URLs for
OpenStack services that look like
`http://<service>.openstack.example.org`. This patch changes the URLs
for hypothetical keystone Service Providers to use HTTPS endpoints to
set a good example of security, to use the example.org domain instead of
localhost or example.com, to include keystone in the name for clarity of
what the service is, and to use a consistent URL path and port. It
doesn't include 'openstack' in the domain name because that becomes a
bit long.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/urls.html

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I8e12edaa589be3c8e71b10d0609c057fd2bfb247

subject: Handle if graph_vertex is None
messages:

As far as I understand, we *do* want to call the method if graph_vertex is None. The aggregated value is calculated based on either vertex or graph_vertex, so it is enough that one of them is not None.

Can you please share the example that caused the exception?'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2019-01-04 04:28:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As far as I understand, we *do* want to call the method if
 > graph_vertex is None. The aggregated value is calculated based on
 > either vertex or graph_vertex, so it is enough that one of them is
 > not None.
 > 
 > Can you please share the example that caused the exception?

 > As far as I understand, we *do* want to call the method if
 > graph_vertex is None. The aggregated value is calculated based on
 > either vertex or graph_vertex, so it is enough that one of them is
 > not None.
 > 
 > Can you please share the example that caused the exception?

I've tested with Vitrage rocky. Here is the log:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/739899/

You can see that vertex wasn't None but graph_vertex was. If graph_vertex was None, graph_vertex didn't have __getitem__ attribute (dict type attribute) (graph_vertex[VProps.VITRAGE_TYPE])."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-01-06 09:01:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I've tested with Vitrage rocky. Here is the log:
 > 
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/739899/
 > 
 > You can see that vertex wasn't None but graph_vertex was. If
 > graph_vertex was None, graph_vertex didn't have __getitem__
 > attribute (dict type attribute) (graph_vertex[VProps.VITRAGE_TYPE]).

Looking at line 58 of datasource_info_mapper, and according to the log you sent, I believe the problem is that new_vertex doesn't have a vitrage_type property. This is not a valid vertex. Even if you fix the None exception you won't have a vitrage_type, so something else will fail later on. 

Please try to understand why the new_vertex looks like that."}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2019-01-07 01:19:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I've tested with Vitrage rocky. Here is the log:
 > >
 > > http://paste.openstack.org/show/739899/
 > >
 > > You can see that vertex wasn't None but graph_vertex was. If
 > > graph_vertex was None, graph_vertex didn't have __getitem__
 > > attribute (dict type attribute) (graph_vertex[VProps.VITRAGE_TYPE]).
 > 
 > Looking at line 58 of datasource_info_mapper, and according to the
 > log you sent, I believe the problem is that new_vertex doesn't have
 > a vitrage_type property. This is not a valid vertex. Even if you
 > fix the None exception you won't have a vitrage_type, so something
 > else will fail later on.
 > 
 > Please try to understand why the new_vertex looks like that.

Thank you for pointing that."}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2019-01-07 01:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Ignore my previous comment! Tested and works beautifully, including for Neutron LBaaS v2. Thanks guys!'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-11 20:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-11 21:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-13 08:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-13 09:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-14 02:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-14 03:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-12-14 06:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-14 07:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Does cinder work for you?

LBaaS works excellent with the pre_delete hook as well. Cinder is not working for me.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-17 10:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-17 10:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Really keen on merging this and backporting to Queens :)'}, {'account_id': 28502, 'date': '2018-12-17 17:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-18 03:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-18 08:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

Feilong, have you tried these approaches for attaching cinder volumes:
-  https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/examples/cinder-csi-plugin/nginx.yaml
-  https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/examples/cinder-flexvolume/nginx.yaml

The one in the docs looks a little out of date:
- https://docs.openstack.org/magnum/latest/user/#using-cinder-in-kubernetes'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 09:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 09:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

After this PS, cinder volumes work. Tested.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-18 09:18:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Some minor points! Good to hear that its working... I'd like to hear about whether you had any luck with `openstack.org/standalone-cinder` and other out of tree cinder volume approaches..."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 09:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 10:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 11:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-12-18 13:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Can you please cross check these settings:

1. the cloud config file should be in "/etc/kubernetes/cloud-config" (hard coded in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/volume/cinder/cinder.go#L43) Please preserve/use this exact name/path.
2. the file "/etc/kubernetes/cloud-config"  should be available to the following processes (where ever they may be running!, if they are in containers then the file needs to be mounted)
    - kubelet
    - kube-controller-manager
    - openstack-cloud-controller-manager
    - kube-apiserver
3. kubelet should have `--cloud-provider=external` (the hard coded path in #1 and #2 will be picked up)
4. kube-controller-manager should have `--cloud-provider=external` and `--external-cloud-volume-plugin=openstack`
5. openstack-cloud-controller-manager should have `--cloud-config=/etc/kubernetes/cloud-config`
6. kube-apiserver should have `--cloud-provider=external`'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-12-18 13:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Great review Davanum! I was going to do the check but you beat me to it!'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

What I mean is: These services do not require the arg "--cloud-config=/etc/kubernetes/cloud-config" to be passed in... they may still require the path to be mounted but I haven't checked.
    - kubelet
    - kube-apiserver'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-12-18 15:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Bharat,

when you do --cloud-provider=external, the --cloud-config is essentially ignored and the file is picked up from the hard coded path (except for the kube-controller-manager which needs the --cloud-config to go with the external-cloud-volume-plugin option)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-18 15:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Bharat,
 > 
 > when you do --cloud-provider=external, the --cloud-config is
 > essentially ignored and the file is picked up from the hard coded
 > path (except for the kube-controller-manager which needs the
 > --cloud-config to go with the external-cloud-volume-plugin option)



From my tests I confirm that only the kube-controller-manager (because of the above reason) and the OCCM require the paramater "--cloud-config".'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-12-19 09:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-19 11:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

Excellent!'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-20 01:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

ï¼ Spyros, I tested this patch again with k8s image v1.11.2-1 and v1.11.5-2, both of them failed to create pvc. Can you please let me know what's the image you used for the testing? Cheers.

See error in kube-controller-manager as below:
Dec 20 01:46:52 k8s-3-v6aujl4qel2o-master-0.novalocal runc[3772]: I1220 01:46:52.534295       1 event.go:221] Event(v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"PersistentVolumeClaim", Namespace:"default", Name:"cinder-pvc", UID:"3dc49b4c-03f6-11e9-b02e-fa163e97ebf9", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"1868", FieldPath:""}): type: 'Warning' reason: 'ProvisioningFailed' Failed to provision volume with StorageClass "cinder-standard": failed to create a 1 GB volume: Invalid request due to incorrect syntax or missing required parameters.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

Feilong, mind sharing the yaml spec you are using to create the pvc and storage class? Thanks'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-20 23:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I found the root cause https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/534fa38f4cb364cb6584c273be8ae2580fabe627#diff-0a99ff5fdecf8d5ecb0447b1eada2b01

I will test this again after upgrade cinder.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-20 23:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Based on the cinder fix mentioned above, the patch works for me. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-12-21 00:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-12-21 06:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

Nice! How did you incorporate the patch?'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-01-02 15:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

There is one caveat with this approach... if a fixed_subnet is specified in the cluster template that is not UUID, the openstack-cloud-controller-manager pod fails to fulfil any requests. We need to map fixed-subnet names to UUID when generating cloud-config file.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-01-06 21:25:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Workflow+1

Hi Bharat, I'm going to approve this patch since the issue you mentioned is mostly not related to this patch itself. And please feel free to propose a following patch to fix it if I'm wrong. Thanks."}]

[{'created': '2018-06-22 17:10:17.000000000', 'message': 'Updating cloud-controller arguments for external providers

The current configuration for external cloud providers is incorrect and
the kubelet requires different arguments to work with external cloud
resources. These changes will allow the cloud controller manager to be
operational.

Change-Id: Ife5558f1db4e581b64cc4a8ffead151f7b405702
Task: 22361
Story: 2002652

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Use external kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack

* Use the external cloud-provider [0]
* Label master nodes
* Make the script the deploys the cloud-provider and clusterroles
  for the apiserver a SoftwareDeployment
* Rename kube_openstack_config to cloud-config,
  for cinder to workm the kubelet expects the cloud config name only
  like this. Keep a copy of kube_openstack_config for backwards
  compatibility.

Change-Id: Ife5558f1db4e581b64cc4a8ffead151f7b405702
Task: 22361
Story: 2002652
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Correct default policy file

Since Queens, the default policy file is policy.yaml, but the
code is still looking for policy.json.  This patch corrects the
location and includes a release note.

Change-Id: I997109d6bd1adbcbf72c056f78f1e01547d0fcbd
Closes-bug: #1805550
(cherry picked from commit f6c11c2ceab035c65dedab6f514b6be28b1859bb)
(cherry picked from commit d07abe397c5bdfb45a82150fb7e1a9efaf21ce42)

[{'created': '2018-12-21 22:09:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454

commit_message:
Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
(cherry picked from commit 47b7c4f3cc582bf463fd0c796df84736a0074f48)
(cherry picked from commit f5d8ee1bfc3b7b9f1a25f85b42e207db0c9f4b04)

[{'created': '2018-11-06 16:35:17.000000000', 'message': "Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

Whe doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on
RabbitMQ and DB connections, which result in the volume service
appearing as down to the scheduler.

greenthreads, preventing switching to another greenthread on I/O as they
should.

Closes-Bug: #1801958
Change-Id: I8a8fbf96875319a7e5ca167fcd2bca45f57649c8
"}, {'created': '2018-12-06 19:24:03.000000000', 'message': "Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

image operations (fetch, put, verify image, ...) that could prevent

Closes-Bug: #1801958
Change-Id: I8a8fbf96875319a7e5ca167fcd2bca45f57649c8

commit_message:
Ensure image utils don't block greenthreads

When doing image operations in Cinder we may start getting errors on
RabbitMQ and DB connections, which result in the volume service
appearing as down to the scheduler.

This is caused by file I/O operations, that in some cases block
greenthreads, preventing switching to another greenthread on I/O as they
should.

This results in many different errors, so this patch makes sure that
image operations (fetch, put, verify image, ...) that could prevent
greenthread switching are executed in native threads.

Closes-Bug: #1801958
Change-Id: I8a8fbf96875319a7e5ca167fcd2bca45f57649c8

commit_message:
Perform ironic online data migrations

Online data migrations are necessary for performing an upgrade of
ironic. Without this change, an error such as the following may be seen
in task 'bifrost-ironic-install : Upgrade ironic DB Schema'.

The database is not compatible with this release of ironic (10.1.7).
Please run "ironic-dbsync online_data_migrations" using the previous
release.

Change-Id: I685efd14bf3567a126311b676a50b0abb0f043db
Story: 2004670
Task: 28658

commit_message:
Avoid changing name of existing ports

In before, we renamed existing neutron ports in order to make
the ports searchable by using endpoint_id.
However, user experience is bad on such renaming because the original
name is lost. This commit proposes to use tagging approach instead.
In particular, we tag the endpoint_id to the existing ports so that
the ports are still searchable by using tags.

Closes-Bug: #1810219
Change-Id: I9930f3bcc3a6dbf4b23bf8488f08655bc43b5ba8

commit_message:
Untag resource if it was tagged

On removing a tag to a resource (port/subnet/subnetpool/network),
if the resource doesn't have the tag, skip the neutron API call to
remove_tag because the tags will be unchanged.
This will avoid one or two Neutron API calls and optimize the
performance a bit.

Partial-Bug: #1809306
Change-Id: Iffa5fbf27c64f1aad0a9bb97da9c4e7c5015a196

commit_message:
Tag resource if it was not tagged

On adding a tag to a resource (port/subnet/subnetpool/network),
if the resource already has the tag, skip the neutron API call to
add_tag because the tags will be unchanged.
This will avoid one or two Neutron API calls and optimize the
performance a bit.

Partial-Bug: #1809306
Change-Id: I8a181d6af5228007d36fa8b217fec7f766dd37fd

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary port update

Kuryr update pre-created neutron port twice. The first one is in
'ipam_request_address' and it updates the following attributes:
* name
* admin_state_up
* mac_address

The second port update is in 'network_driver_create_endpoint' and
several attributes are written including name and mac_address.
This commit remove the first port update to optimize the performance.
The update of admin_state_up will be moved to the second port update.

Change-Id: I743b2088366d910902775cabefa43be2865e37c5
Partial-Bug: #1809306

commit_message:
Change subvolume create to unmask errors

The subvolume creation task was running such that all errors were being
masked. This change uses the creates argument to give us an idempotent
task while also ensuring we're not masking real errors.

Change-Id: I3b87457e8871128c32b8829f440ea69e0623bfd8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Remove auth_uri"

Mistral is still using auth_uri, we need to look why but
this patch broke TripleO CI.
Let's revert it for now, and investigate how we can
fix the Mistral.

This reverts commit 2f8d0c392690883d5c409f7002c6a99a32342059.
Related-Bug: #1809974

Change-Id: I6b28a31baee2eb0c00798ae694c658b0720d5fb6

commit_message:

Namespaces within the urllib2 package have
changed between python2x and python3x.

Closes-bug: #1810610

commit_message:
Add testing for to_array_of_json_strings func

Adds the unit test for the to_array_of_json_strings
function that is proposed here [1].

This is to ensure we did not break the function with
the following fix [2].

Some scenarios in the testing will fail because [1] also
fixes a broken functionality that was never discovered due
to having no testing before.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614241/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613445/

Change-Id: I3b98f07b7f5e62e17dee23a405e34ad483320bbe

commit_message:
Uplift Ceph charts to the Mimic release

Change the release of Ceph from 12.2.3 (Luminous) to latest 13.2.2
(Mimic). Additionally use supported RHEL/Centos Images rather then
Ubuntu images, which are now considered deprecated by Redhat.

- Uplift all Ceph images to the latest 13.2.2 ceph-container images.
- RadosGW by default will now use the Beast backend.
- RadosGW has relaxed settings enabled for S3 naming conventions.
- Increased RadosGW resource limits due to backend change.
- All Luminous specific tests now test for both Luminous/Mimic.
- Gate scripts will remove all none required ceph packages. This is
required to not conflict with the pid/gid that the Redhat container
uses.

Change-Id: I9c00f3baa6c427e6223596ade95c65c331e763fb

commit_message:
Helm-toolkit: Update job for creating s3 buckets

This updates the helm-toolkit manifest template and scipts for
creating an S3 bucket and linking it to a user. This moves away
from the previous python implementation that used rgwadmin, and
instead uses s3cmd for a cleaner approach that can support more
recent versions of ceph

Change-Id: I305062a5daa063bfe21a12448d7a3957bca00bf4

commit_message:
Cleanup LDAP integration guide

This commit fixes a grammar issue in the LDAP integration guide
and it adds prompts to the command-line examples to be more
explicit about where or how commands are being run.

Change-Id: Ic6a5adfbcf2841656929e6c3875889a31d314089

commit_message:
Drop the deprecated and now removed barrier XFS mount options

Both barrier and nobarrier were deprecated with the 4.10 kernel [1] and
then removed [2] with the 4.19 kernel as now used by Fedora >= 28. Both
should be safe to drop at this point.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d50

Change-Id: I6871a7765e3e04122d8d546f43d36bb8415383fc

subject: Rework old customization templates and add new blocks
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can make a blueprint to match and update the commit message, but please review that this looks/sounds sane.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:22:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I agree that lots of customization templates is silly... And to be honest I want to encourage people to use the better inheritance features Django supports with templates, and we can now use them.

I have a better idea that will give us far more flexibility but I don't know how we can 'deprecate' these custom templates. Other than release notes and eventual removal, we can't log anything when/if people use them. We can stick comments in them that they are deprecated at least I guess.

I think the best solution is to add lots of blocks to the base template around all these existing custom templates, then write some docs about how to use recursive inheritance to overextend a template nicely (mostly the base template), and then add notes that these custom templates will be removed eventually and people should stop using them in favor of overextending the templates and adding additional content to the blocks.

Let me take a crack at this tomorrow. I'll try and put together something to get across what I mean with some examples."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-18 02:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-18 02:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Akihiro Hows this look? Please do test the example theme so you see what it is doing.

But this is the way we should move to using our templates and encourage themes to be written.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-18 03:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-20 04:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-04-20 09:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-04-25 14:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-26 00:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-26 00:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-26 00:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-04-27 10:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-27 17:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I believe you need to add a release note which explains what are changed and how the existing customized templates can be updated to the new style.

In addition, is it 100% backward compatible? I haven't checked the detail one by one, but I think it is worth asked.

(-1 is due to the lack of a release note)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-27 17:40:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

> In addition, is it 100% backward compatible? I haven't checked the detail one by one, but I think it is worth asked.

IMHO it is better to keep the old styles for a while with deprecation notice if possible. This is the way we usually replaces old ones with new ones, but in this case the conversion would be simple in most case, so I am okay with either way."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-30 09:38:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Will add a release note.

 > > In addition, is it 100% backward compatible? I haven't checked
 > the detail one by one, but I think it is worth asked.
 > 
 > IMHO it is better to keep the old styles for a while with
 > deprecation notice if possible. This is the way we usually replaces
 > old ones with new ones, but in this case the conversion would be
 > simple in most case, so I am okay with either way.

Isn't really backwards compatible, since we ideally want to get rid of some of those extra templates. That's why I've kept them and added deprecation notes. A release note about said deprecation will also be needed.

The big thing is that this should hopefully serve as a good example of how recursive inheritance works, and potentially allow us to play with more of it in our own internal horizon templates. The more blocks we build into all our templates, the easier it gets to use it effectively. It's just a matter of figuring out what the places are where people often want to override things and making sure they have blocks to use.

And ideally when: https://github.com/django/django/pull/9884 is done and merged into Django core, we can link to it to explain how it all works. Although do give it a read now if you can to make sure it makes sense! Feedback is appreciated."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-01 19:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Adrian Turjak wrote:

> Will add a release note.
>
> > > In addition, is it 100% backward compatible? I haven't checked
> > > the detail one by one, but I think it is worth asked.
>
> > IMHO it is better to keep the old styles for a while with
> > deprecatio notice if possible. This is the way we usually replaces
> > old ones with new ones, but in this case the conversion would be
> > simple in most case, so I am okay with either way.
>
> Isn't really backwards compatible, since we ideally want to get rid
> of some of those extra templates. That's why I've kept them and
> added deprecation notes. A release note about said deprecation will
> also be needed.

I checked one by one. It looks like backward-compatible for the existing
template including, so I think it looks no problem.

>
> The big thing is that this should hopefully serve as a good example
> of how recursive inheritance works, and potentially allow us to play
> with more of it in our own internal horizon templates. The more
> blocks we build into all our templates, the easier it gets to use it
> effectively. It's just a matter of figuring out what the places are
> where people often want to override things and making sure they have
> blocks to use.

This itself is fine to me. Thanks for initiating this effort.
My previous comment is about how existing customized templates are affected.
It seems existing templates can be used as-is even after this patch is merged.


>
> And ideally when: https://github.com/django/django/pull/9884 is done
> and merged into Django core, we can link to it to explain how it all
> works. Although do give it a read now if you can to make sure it
> makes sense! Feedback is appreciated."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-01 19:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I am fine with this version once a release note is added.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-07 03:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> I am fine with this version once a release note is added.

Will add a release note!'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 04:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 05:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 05:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 05:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 06:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 06:12:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Ok, did some clean up, and added a release note. Please review and make sure I've not done something silly or odd. :)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-15 10:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

Generally looks good, but I have a question on "security". Could you explain more detail?'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 23:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-23 01:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-28 02:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-30 04:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-07 02:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-06-22 19:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-24 20:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I have a bit concern about resolving a security topic without filing a bug and being discussed with the security team. We need to evaluate the level of security impacts. Mixing a security topic and a refacoring sounds tricky to me (although the new template block approach itself looks good to me).

Could you first file a bug with "Public Security"?

I still haven't be able to judge how your point on "security" would impact... and we need more eyes. At least I am afraid that regular operators cannot evaluate a security risk pointed here from the current release note.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-27 05:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I have a bit concern about resolving a security topic without
 > filing a bug and being discussed with the security team. We need to
 > evaluate the level of security impacts. Mixing a security topic and
 > a refacoring sounds tricky to me (although the new template block
 > approach itself looks good to me).
 > 
 > Could you first file a bug with "Public Security"?
 > 
 > I still haven't be able to judge how your point on "security" would
 > impact... and we need more eyes. At least I am afraid that regular
 > operators cannot evaluate a security risk pointed here from the
 > current release note.

To be fair, it isn't really a security risk. It's an advisory to follow a better pattern that stops a potential security risk occurring in future.

The risk doesn't exist yet. The idea here is to stop it being a security risk, and adding in the security section of the release note makes sure people see it, and act on it before it becomes a risk.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-27 05:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-07-02 18:32:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: -Code-Review

I'll keep my vote until Akihiro's comments will be addressed"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-17 01:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-17 02:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-07-22 23:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Published edit on patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-07-25 18:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm OK to get this merged in Rocke before Feature Freeze [1] if release notes are clear enough about security impact.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/rocky/schedule.html#r-3"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(1 comment)

This patch is generally in good shape, but we are blocked by the term "security" for a long time. How can we move this forward?'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:45:20.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 months without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-03 03:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Patch Set 17 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 07:47:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new block and template for analytics

Most deployers want to be able to include analytics code
into their theme for Horizon, but often in doing so end up
having that code run on all pages. Some plugins and pages
ideally should not be tracked, and need a better way to
turn of tracking for those pages.

This gives us a block we can override to be emtpy on pages
deemed sensitive provided the deployers are following our
suggested usage guide.

commit_message:
Rework old customization templates and add new blocks

From Rocky we can now support Django's recursive template
inheritance. Let's move away from all these stand alone
templates for deployers to override and instead direct them
to recursively extend the existing templates and the blocks they
need.

This adds more blocks, docs on how to use them, and an example
theme which can be turned on and used to show how this works.

blueprint: less-customization-templates
Change-Id: I69f1e16ff1b88cec78580df0911fe3c01b7507dd

commit_message:
Migrate nova v2.0 legacy job to zuulv3

This commit migrate the legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-api
job to zullv3 native with new job - tempest-nova-v2-api

Conflicts:
      .zuul.yaml

The conflict is due to Ife046b91c96dd300e8c46125b75623d8e12b8da3

Change-Id: I6915b7deca20eabb88c231b287586c64cdcf3646
(cherry picked from commit f7a4ba969abdeb6b307ca4052da317b7c0b2ec3f)

[{'created': '2019-01-04 11:06:55.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Do a vgscan before checking if the VG is there

There might be a rescan for volume groups needed before checking if
the volume group is already there. Otherwise, the check for the volume
group fails which means the code tries to create the volume, but that
fails then because the volume is already there.
Here is the devstack run log:

  [...]
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:538  sudo losetup -f --show /opt/stack/data/lvm-shares-backing-file
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:538  DEV=/dev/loop2
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:543  sudo vgs lvm-shares
    Volume group "lvm-shares" not found
    Cannot process volume group lvm-shares
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:543  sudo vgcreate lvm-shares /dev/loop2
    Physical volume '/dev/loop2' is already in volume group 'lvm-shares'
    Unable to add physical volume '/dev/loop2' to volume group 'lvm-shares'
    /dev/loop2: physical volume not initialized.
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:1  exit_trap
  [...]

Change-Id: I0189580ae40b180249fd5846aa986052e44ce2c2
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Do a vgscan before checking if the VG is there

There might be a rescan for volume groups needed before checking if
the volume group is already there. Otherwise, the check for the volume
group fails which means the code tries to create the volume, but that
fails then because the volume is already there.
Here is the devstack run log:

  [...]
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:538  sudo losetup -f --show /opt/stack/data/lvm-shares-backing-file
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:538  DEV=/dev/loop2
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:543  sudo vgs lvm-shares
    Volume group "lvm-shares" not found
    Cannot process volume group lvm-shares
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:543  sudo vgcreate lvm-shares /dev/loop2
    Physical volume '/dev/loop2' is already in volume group 'lvm-shares'
    Unable to add physical volume '/dev/loop2' to volume group 'lvm-shares'
    /dev/loop2: physical volume not initialized.
  plugin.sh:configure_backing_file:1  exit_trap
  [...]

Change-Id: I0189580ae40b180249fd5846aa986052e44ce2c2
