commit_message:
Allow customization of more openshift-ansible vars

The `openshift_master_cluster_hostname` and
`openshift_master_cluster_public_hostname` variables are set to IP
addresses by tripleo, but were wrongly combined with the
openshift_global_vars dictionnary in a way that prevented customization
via the OpenShiftGlobalVariables heat parameter.

Reverse the order of the combine to make customization possible as they
should.

Change-Id: I47805608b90d8fda7d8357d3cb55f6372e746da1
Closes-Bug: #1806736

commit_message:
Adjust ssh timeouts

Generic driver jobs are failing because of timeouts when
establishing the initial ssh connection from manila-share
to the service VM.

Bump up the default value of the connection timeout for paramiko
client and also set the banner timeout since the failure occurred
during banner exchange.  Set the two timeouts to the same value
for now.  This ensures that the connection timeout is at least as
long as the banner timeout and there is no current need in manila
to control these independently.

This is more of a workaround than a real fix since a real fix
would remove the delay during banner exchange.  I suspect that
the real fix will need to be in neutron/ovs though.

Change-Id: Ib5e59faaf9667b9cb5e7d4072531b7d6c3d4da39
Partial-bug: #1807216

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ia98573704e93d8c70e5c6448a548ce68b0427fee
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

openstack-dev.

Change-Id: I28d197968671da2f7ed1c0c604be50eb82a63f32

commit_message:
Update docs building

The repo used both openstackdocstheme and oslosphinx in requirements but
then configured openstackdocstheme, remove oslosphinx everywhere.

Instead of using sphinx-build, use  docstheme-build-translated.sh to
build English and translated documents.

Update doc/source/conf.py for newer openstackdocstheme and require
a new enough version.

Remove module index - it does not exist, this is not a python repo where
autodoc works.

Remove sphinx-quickstart generated output from index.rst, it's not
needed anymore.

Change-Id: Ib3f09128226f0bcc78384b1ee2da811d62a5b59d

commit_message:
QNAP: Fix inconsistent cases while create/manage from snapshot

There are two situation may cause the size of share/snapshot
managed by manila is inconsistent with the NAS backend.
One is to create a share from snapshot. While the other one
is to manage an existing snapshot.

Change-Id: Iaef8d8cb4be0d8872a2796c0fc69279c14f15a80
Closes-Bug: #1810476

commit_message:
Remove documentation-build error flag globally on prepare cleanup

This is a common operation in all the spec files so it makes
sense to add it to the globally executed macro in the prep step.

Change-Id: Icdda110c19509dbd66a00609c625b38767e6961f

commit_message:
Add missing role_specific tag for NUMA aware vswitches params

Change I318ba9c262f64c0d416a017ed836ae0729acedb4 expose NUMA
aware vswitches configuration parameter, which are role-specific.

The proposed patch adds role_specific tag for those parameters
which is missed in original patch.

Change-Id: I96fd7dfc5468bf1dbdc665b3d848b40223ee9454

commit_message:
Fix congre command excute error when using python3.6

when test murano python3 in patch [0], murano-congress-devstack
failed when excute congress command, error as below:
2018-12-28 05:33:03.601901 | controller | ++ functions-common:oscwrap:2287 :
out='openstack: '\''congress datasource create neutronv2 neutronv2 --config poll_time=10 --config username=admin
--config tenant_name=admin --config password=secretadmin --config auth_url=http://38.108.68.25/identity'\''
is not an openstack command. See '\''openstack --help'\''.
2018-12-28 05:33:03.601983 | controller | Did you mean one of these?
2018-12-28 05:33:03.602029 | controller |   address scope create
2018-12-28 05:33:03.602057 | controller |   address scope delete
2018-12-28 05:33:03.602082 | controller |   address scope list
2018-12-28 05:33:03.602122 | controller |   address scope set
2018-12-28 05:33:03.602149 | controller |   address scope show'
2018-12-28 05:33:03.604233 | controller | + functions-common:oscwrap:1               :   exit_trap
This patch using setup_dev_lib function from devstack install python-congressclient,
also this patch add a way to install congresscliet from requirements.

[0]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624600/

Change-Id: Ifda90653ca515bd5e21e5ed7338ab9fbdacc86ec

subject: www-generator.py: cache expensive repo/project metadata to disk
messages: [{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 17:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-04 17:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-04 20:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-05 06:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 17:11:59.000000000', 'message': 'www-generator.py: cache expensive repo/project metadata to disk

Gathering the metadata of repos and projects requires a significant
number of HTTP calls and is therefore slow and expensive.  When
hacking on www-generator.py the ability to skip these calls can save a
lot of time allowing much more rapid iteration.  So add a persistent
cache for this data, using the percache Python module.

This is mostly run in the gate, where the cache will be deleted on
each run.  Documentation contributors running this locally may
occasionally need to manually remove the cache file, although
governance data generally changes slow enough that this is expected to
be a rare corner case.

As noted by the comment in _get_official_repos(), in the future we may
add support for loading governance data from a local repo, thereby
skipping the need for slow HTTP calls.  But for now this is a simpler
solution.

Change-Id: Ib52171625e37169d00da03f436b58456c103b04d
'}]
commit_message:
www-generator.py: cache expensive repo/project metadata to disk

Gathering the metadata of repos and projects requires a significant
number of HTTP calls and is therefore slow and expensive.  When
hacking on www-generator.py the ability to skip these calls can save a
lot of time allowing much more rapid iteration.  So add a persistent
cache for this data, using the percache Python module.

This is mostly run in the gate, where the cache will be deleted on
each run.  Documentation contributors running this locally may
occasionally need to manually remove the cache file, although
governance data generally changes slow enough that this is expected to
be a rare corner case.

As noted by the comment in _get_official_repos(), in the future we may
add support for loading governance data from a local repo, thereby
skipping the need for slow HTTP calls.  But for now this is a simpler
solution.

Change-Id: Ib52171625e37169d00da03f436b58456c103b04d

commit_message:
Remove py34 and add py36 support

Due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, only python3.5 is
available(Python3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka). So, there is no
need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I8acd363b9c1d4d14a83e3fcbc5308b362268b69c

"}, {'created': '2019-01-03 21:56:28.000000000', 'message': "Kube-State-Metrics: Add pod security context for pod user

"}, {'created': '2019-01-03 22:09:29.000000000', 'message': "Kube-State-Metrics: Add pod/container security context

security context on the pod template. This changes the pod's
user from root to the nobody user instead

allowPrivilegeEscalation to false

commit_message:
Kube-State-Metrics: Add pod/container security context

This updates the kube-state-metrics chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template. This changes the pod's
user from root to the nobody user instead

This also adds the container security context to explicitly set
allowPrivilegeEscalation to false

Change-Id: I17748b299a6e7a394cae63a0e713c49fbf68b4eb

Update auth parameters

Some parameters have been deprecated in puppet-manila
Whereas we are picking up deprecated parameters, it's good
that we fix this already here as well.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 14:51:37.000000000', 'message': "Always use a virtualenv in CI testing

Currently all of the opensuse 150 jobs are failing due to being unable
to install virtualbmc via pip. The failure signature is:

Cannot uninstall 'six'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we
cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to
only a partial uninstall.

The usual solution to this problem is to install Python packages in a
virtual environment. This change modifies the test-bifrost.sh script to
use a virtual environment in all cases.

Change-Id: I2840ec32cffcaf5d7f32a91907d51c1a500f19f1

commit_message:
Use a virtualenv in openSUSE CI testing

Currently all of the opensuse 150 jobs are failing due to being unable
to install virtualbmc via pip. The failure signature is:

Cannot uninstall 'six'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we
cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to
only a partial uninstall.

The usual solution to this problem is to install Python packages in a
virtual environment. This change modifies the zuul CI jobs to use a
virtual environment for all openSUSE jobs.

Change-Id: I2840ec32cffcaf5d7f32a91907d51c1a500f19f1

(2 comments)

This looks OK to me as a backportable workaround for the common deployment situation where ceph storage is shared but the /var/lib/nova/instances instance directories are not shared.

The correct, future fix would be to have a separate "is shared storage" check for instance directories etc vs instance disks and use the result of those checks separately to decide whether to clean up. This is noted in the commit message and would not be backportable because it would involve a remote call to the other compute host.

+1ing for now allow more reviewers to take a look.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-11 19:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Code is well documented, release note explains things, and the [workarounds] option is the appropriate place and signal for a temporary workaround that we intend to replace with a proper fix on master."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-21 22:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Before I dig into replies and changes since the last time I reviewed this, I'll drop the snip of the IRC conversation I had with Lee:

(2:15:39 PM) mriedem: i would feel better about putting in a workaround if we had longer term plans for a solution
(2:16:12 PM) mriedem: and the root of the issue is the root disk is on shared ceph but the instance files aren't?
(2:16:15 PM) mriedem: or vice-versa?
(2:16:38 PM) mriedem: why oh why can't people just use ceph everywhere if they are going to use it at all
(2:16:40 PM) lyarwood: that's correct, the disks are in rbd and shared, the instance directory is not.
(2:16:58 PM) lyarwood: well operators don't have an option here, that's our fault
(2:17:08 PM) mriedem: :/
(2:17:18 PM) lyarwood: we leave the console.log, kernel, ramdisks etc in the instance dir
(2:18:00 PM) mriedem: but the instance dir could be on shared storage itself
(2:18:05 PM) mriedem: ceph, nfs, etc
(2:18:13 PM) lyarwood: correct and nothing checks that at the moment
(2:19:36 PM) mriedem: then why is this solution specific to rbd? just because of the Rbd image backend returning True from "is_shared_block_storage"?
(2:20:09 PM) mriedem: iow, check_instance_shared_storage_local returns true if the image backend assumes that because disks are on shared storage, everything is on shared storage

Change-Id: I8fd6b9f857a1c4919c3365951e2652d2d477df77
Closes-Bug: #1414895
'}, {'created': '2018-12-03 10:47:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Add workaround to remove instance dir during cleanup with rbd

At present all virt drivers provide a cleanup method that takes a single
destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation the value of destroy_disks is
determined by the compute layer calling down both into the
check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver and
remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on the
host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up evacuations. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are
stored separately to the instance directory that needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared and would
need to also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by seperating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

Related-Bug: #1414895
Change-Id: I8fd6b9f857a1c4919c3365951e2652d2d477df77

destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation or revert resize the value of
destroy_disks is determined by the compute layer calling down both into
the check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver
and remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on
the host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are stored
separately to the instance directory that still needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared
independently of the disks on a NFS share for example and would need to
also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by separating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

Related-Bug: #1761062
Related-Bug: #1414895

commit_message:
libvirt: Add workaround to cleanup instance dir when using rbd

At present all virt drivers provide a cleanup method that takes a single
destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation or revert resize the value of
destroy_disks is determined by the compute layer calling down both into
the check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver
and remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on
the host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are stored
separately to the instance directory that still needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared
independently of the disks on a NFS share for example and would need to
also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by separating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

Related-Bug: #1761062
Partial-Bug: #1414895
Change-Id: I8fd6b9f857a1c4919c3365951e2652d2d477df77

commit_message:
Allow network data with no entries

When deploying without network isolation we should
allow an empty network_data.yaml with no networks.

In combination with tripleo-heat-templates change:
Ifeb2d2d1acb43c16a5bf29e95965776494d61fef the
tripleoclient can be update to use /dev/null as
network data, and networks can be removed from
roles/Standalone.yaml and roles/Undercloud.yaml.

Related-Bug: #1809313
Change-Id: I2e8135bc9389d3bf1a6ef01e273515af5c488a9a

vmware-recheck-patch'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Sean: In the case that I outlined, you do end up with the wrong metadata.  This is not described in the commit message or the bug.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Not sure I'm following. So you have X as a full backup, X1 as an incremental, and X2 as an incremental. You have some metadata initially and create X. Then you delete the metadata and create X1. You then add some metadata back and create X2.

So on restore, X is applied and the old original metadata is set on the volume. It then moves on to X1 which doesn't have any metadata to set. We don't have anything to clear metadata, so in this step you do indeed end up with an error of having X's metadata applied to X1's state. But that is an existing failure in our existing backup processing and not mentioned as a goal for this patch or the references bug. Then X2 is applied and the final and correct metadata is applied.

So there is a bug out there, but it isn't really related to this patch. If the metadata is deleted between X1 and X2, there is a problem that you will end up with X1's metadata when it should now be empty. But as far as optimizing things, this patch makes it more correct and will actually indirectly help that issue by only applying what it sees from the last backup.

So this does what it says it is trying to do, which is an improvement, and it addresses what is detailed in the bug report."}]

commit_message:
Only restore last metadata on backup restore

When restoring a chain of backups, it starts with the last full
backup, then applies each incremental backup from there. We
only need to restore the metadata from the last backup in the
chain.

Existing code was setting the metadata repeatedly in the chain.
This updates the process to only apply the most recent metadata
that we need.

Change-Id: I5f2aea0601e1a3ad652d817d1d5bb72517a7e150
Closes-Bug: #1686334

commit_message:
Updating nova and neutron configuration

Since we stopped support of keystonev2, we need to be able to specify a
domain in neutron and nova configuration. Might as well add all the
options and remove the deprecated ones.

Co-authored-by: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I745a170ac4458a3f13efc255fc37540a11b54274
Closes-Bug: #1802393

[{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-18 22:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-19 23:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-12-20 07:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-03 10:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are the test changes required with this policy string change?'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-01-03 22:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Are the test changes required with this policy string change?

Yeah, because the default policy check string is changing. The self.$HTTP_METHOD implementation we have in tests default to using self.user, with an admin role assignment on the admin project (or the legacy way of determining who is an admin).

Since we're evolving that to include proper system admin support, I had to include test changes to make sure they were using a system-scoped token to access the impacted APIs."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-04 10:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-04 12:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Use common system role definitions for registered limits

A recent set of changes added a common role definition for system
administrators and system readers. Instead of rewriting the same thing
in each policy module, we can just reference a single consistent
string available in base.py.

Change-Id: I9de01478fe45a9935d901e4936f6c56bfceac6ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 15:00:48.000000000', 'message': 'Move/Drop useless SQL related config options

The following config option was moved to another place:

- [Default]sqlite_db : Only used for testing so move it to the test
  config options. That way, it is not visible in the
  manila.conf.sample file

The following config options were removed and are now handled via
oslo.db:

- [Default]sqlite_synchronous : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]sqlite_synchronous" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_idle_timeout : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]connection_recycle_time" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_max_retries : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]max_retries" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_retry_interval : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]retry_interval" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled

Change-Id: I17e9b69d4ce4b8e624313d05f72d25b3fc2b458c
'}]
commit_message:
Move/Drop useless SQL related config options

The following config option was moved to another place:

- [Default]sqlite_db : Only used for testing so move it to the test
  config options. That way, it is not visible in the
  manila.conf.sample file

The following config options were removed and are now handled via
oslo.db:

- [Default]sqlite_synchronous : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]sqlite_synchronous" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_idle_timeout : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]connection_recycle_time" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_max_retries : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]max_retries" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled
- [Default]sql_retry_interval : already handled by oslo.db . The new
  place is "[database]retry_interval" but the deprecated
  section/names are handled

Change-Id: I17e9b69d4ce4b8e624313d05f72d25b3fc2b458c

commit_message:
[Configuration] Update min tox version.

The commands used by constraits need at least tox 2.0, update to reflect
reality, which should help with local running constraints targets.

Change-Id: I422714a265305143137c345cb86b6e0318d68df2

10:57 < quiquell> marios_|ruck: we have "standalone-upgrade" tag and "standalone_upgrade" attribute

10:58 < quiquell> marios_|ruck: new mechanism use "extra_tags" to just add the new ones
10:58 < quiquell> marios_|ruck: In that job the new one is standalone-upgrade comparing to the base job standalone
10:58 < quiquell> marios_|ruck: so at the standalone upgrade jobs we have to port it to use extra_tags with your feature

definitions as extra_tags. Part of sprint 19 [1] ongoing work
to remove legacy bash from zuul v3 jobs.

[1] https://trello.com/c/6xqcXtM7/859-translate-oooqcommonfunctionsshj2-piece-by-piece-to-ansible-tasks

Change-Id: Id8bf4e824514935ce54e80d895e571998e359f1f
'}, {'created': '2018-09-25 14:28:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Removes EXTRA_TAGS from toci_gate_test&quickstart.sh.j2

This moves EXTRA_TAGS from toci.*.sh.j2 to the zuul.d job
definitions as extra_tags. Part of sprint 19 [1] ongoing work

commit_message:
Removes EXTRA_TAGS from toci_gate_test&quickstart.sh.j2

This moves EXTRA_TAGS from toci.*.sh.j2 to the zuul.d job
definitions as extra_tags. Part of sprint 19 [1] ongoing work
to remove legacy bash from zuul v3 jobs.

We must merge [2] rdo-jobs first before we merge this so we don't
break those jobs.

Also moves the standalone-upgrade to extra_tags from tags.

[1] https://trello.com/c/6xqcXtM7/859-translate-oooqcommonfunctionsshj2-piece-by-piece-to-ansible-tasks
[2]  https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/17962/

Change-Id: Id8bf4e824514935ce54e80d895e571998e359f1f

commit_message:
Ensure mounts are able to be network aware

The mount unit can take requires and after statements which help ensure
mounts are "mounted" at the appropriate times. This change ensures that
mounts that do not begin with a "/" have network aware statements in
them automatically which ensures things like NFS, CIFS, or iSCSI mounts
are correctly handled at the time of system start.

Change-Id: I0afa240ea4792710b9d6e84831ccac01e0cb3972
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make the elasticsearch plugins optional

The plugin framework within elasticsearch should be optional. This
change documents common plugin usage and changes the plugin array to an
empty list making it so we're not actively installing optional plugins.

Change-Id: I77934d8891e22c99a023396018923bac02355f87
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: L3 routed networks - subnet fixed_ips (3/3)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald JensÃ¥s', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-12 22:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Subnet name can be a parameter ...
Also has suffix _subnet by default.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Need to handle VIP's fixed_ips request as well.
This passes CI, but if we had subnets on the networks the VIP allocation would fail because of neutron segments deffered ip allocation."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-14 06:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-07-20 00:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

It seems like a hassle to have to craft all the parameters that would be needed. I wonder if we could add a map of network name to subnet name inside of roles_data.yaml, and then automatically populate the <Role><Network>Subnet and <Network>VipSubnet parameter defaults based on the role data? That would reduce the chances of those parameters not being included and causing issues during updates.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-20 07:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > It seems like a hassle to have to craft all the parameters that
 > would be needed. I wonder if we could add a map of network name to
 > subnet name inside of roles_data.yaml, and then automatically
 > populate the <Role><Network>Subnet and <Network>VipSubnet parameter
 > defaults based on the role data? That would reduce the chances of
 > those parameters not being included and causing issues during
 > updates.

Thanks Dan, I like the idea of using a map in role_data.yaml.

Ideally we would just extend the current 'networks:' map to include it.

Today we have:
  networks:
    - InternalApi
    - Tenant
    - Storage

We change to:
  networks:
    - InternalApi:
        subnet: internal_api_leaf2
        vip: internal_api_leaf2
    - Tenant
        subnet: tenant_leaf2
    - Storage
        subnet: storage_leaf2
        vip: storage_leaf2

Internally we can transform this into a list of just the names by some nested looping:

>>> templ = """
... {%- for network in networks %}
... {%- for key,val in network.items() %}
... {{key}}
... {%- endfor %}
... {%- endfor %}
... """
>>> template = jinja2.Template(templ)
>>> 
>>> 
>>> print template.render({'networks': [{'netA': {'sub': 'subA', 'vip': 'subA'}}, {'netB': {'sub': 'subB', 'vip': 'subB'}}, {'netC': {'sub': 'subC', 'vip': 'subC'}}]})

netA
netB
netC


Internally we can create a role_networs_list variable using jinja's set <varname> or something to avoid doing that nested loop everytime?'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> 
 > Internally we can create a role_networs_list variable using jinja's
 > set <varname> or something to avoid doing that nested loop
 > everytime?

following up previous comment:

I think for compatibility we could put something like this at the top of jinja files:

{%- set _nets = [] %}
{%- for network in networks %}
{%-     if network is mapping %}
{%-         for key,val in network.items() %}
{%-             set _nets = _nets.append(key) %}
{%-         endfor %}
{%-     elif network is string %}
{%-         set _nets = _nets.append(network) %}
{%-     endif %}
{%- endfor %}

Wonder if it would make sense to change networks: to a map instead of a list in roles_data.yaml as well. I.e:
  networks:
    InternalApi:
      subnet: internal_api_leaf2
      vip: internal_api_leaf2
    Tenant:
      subnet: tenant_leaf2
    Storage:
      subnet: storage_leaf2
      vip: storage_leaf2

A similar compatibility shim like the one above would probably have to do {%- if networks is mapping %} to stay compatible with the old format during a deprecation period."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-22 09:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/tripleo-routed-networks-templates to bp/tripleo-routed-networks-templates-future'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-08-22 07:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-08-22 07:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-08-23 09:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-08-23 09:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > It seems like a hassle to have to craft all the parameters that
 > would be needed. I wonder if we could add a map of network name to
 > subnet name inside of roles_data.yaml, and then automatically
 > populate the <Role><Network>Subnet and <Network>VipSubnet parameter
 > defaults based on the role data? That would reduce the chances of
 > those parameters not being included and causing issues during
 > updates.

I made the change to allow mapping the network and subnet in roles data in a separate patch. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 16:49:16.000000000', 'message': 'Composable Networks - routed subnets (part: 3)

Add parameter {{ role.name + network.name}}Subnet.
Defaults to {{network.name_lower}} which is the
default name for the first (and existing) subnet.
When predictable IPs are not used the subnet is
passed to the fixed_ips request when creating
neutron ports.

This allow control of which subnet ports for a role
will be created in. To control the ctlplane subnet
we use {{role.name}}ControlPlaneSubnet, so there is
consistency. For example:

parameters_defaults:
  ComputeLeaf1ControlPlaneSubnet: ctlplane_leaf1
  ComputeLeaf1StorageSubnet: storage_leaf1
  ComputeLeaf1InternalApiSubnet: internal_api_leaf1

Change-Id: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443
Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 07:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Composable networks - L3 routed networks (3/3)

Add parameter {{role.name + network.name}}Subnet.
Defaults to {{network.name_lower}}_subnet which is
the default name for the first (and existing) subnet
unless the user used an override to set a different
name.

Unless predictable IPs are used the subnet specified
in the parameter is passed to the fixed_ips request
when creating neutron ports. This allow control of
which subnet ports for a role will be created in.

parameters_defaults:
  ComputeLeaf1StorageSubnet: storage_leaf1
  ComputeLeaf1InternalApiSubnet: internal_api_leaf1

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443
'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 14:00:54.000000000', 'message': "Composable networks - L3 routed networks (3/3)

Add parameter {{role.name + network.name}}Subnet.
Defaults to {{network.name_lower}}_subnet which is
the default name for the first (and existing) subnet
unless the user used an override to set a different
name.

Unless predictable IPs are used the subnet specified
in the parameter is passed to the fixed_ips request
when creating neutron ports. This allow control of
which subnet ports for a role will be created in.

Also adds parameter's {{network.name}}VipSubnet.
Defaults to {{network.name_lower}}_subnet. When
no VirtualFixedIPs ia not set the VipSubnet is
passed in the fixed_ips request for Vip ports.

Since the fixed_ips request passed to Vip ports
are no longer [] by default, the conditinal has
been updated to test for any 'ip_address' entries
in the request.

  ComputeLeaf1InternalApiSubnet: internal_api_leaf1
  InternalApiVipSubnet: internal_api_leaf0

"}, {'created': '2018-09-03 10:58:25.000000000', 'message': "L3 routed networks - subnet fixed_ips (3/3)

When using neutron routed networks we need to specify
either the subnet or a ip address in the fixed-ips-request
when creating neutron ports.

a) For the Vip's:

Adds VipSubnetMap and VipSubnetMapDefaults parameters in
service_net_map.yaml. The two maps are merged, so that the
operator can override the subnet where VIP port should be
hosted. For example:

parameter_defaults:
  VipSubnetMap:
    ctlplane: ctlplane-leaf1
    InternalApi: internal_api_leaf1
    Storage: storage_leaf1
    redis: internal_api_leaf1

b) For overcloud node ports:

Enrich 'networks' in roles defenition to include both
network and subnet data. Changes the list to a map
instead of a list of strings. New schema:

- name: <role_name>
  networks:
    <network_name>
      subnet: <subnet_name>

For backward compatibility a conditional is used to check
if the data is a map or not. In either case the internal
list of role networks is created as '_role_networks' in
the jinja2 templates.

When the data is a map, and the map contains the 'subnet'
key the subnet specified in roles_data.yaml is used as
the subnet in the fixed-ips-reqest when ports are created.
If subnet is not set (or role.networks is not a map) the
default will be {{network.name_lower}}_subnet.

Also, since the fixed_ips request passed to Vip ports are no
longer [] by default, the conditinal has been updated to
test for 'ip_address' entries in the request.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969
Change-Id: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443

"}, {'created': '2018-09-03 23:10:52.000000000', 'message': "L3 routed networks - subnet fixed_ips (3/3)

When using neutron routed networks we need to specify
either the subnet or a ip address in the fixed-ips-request
when creating neutron ports.

a) For the Vip's:

Adds VipSubnetMap and VipSubnetMapDefaults parameters in
service_net_map.yaml. The two maps are merged, so that the
operator can override the subnet where VIP port should be
hosted. For example:

parameter_defaults:
  VipSubnetMap:
    ctlplane: ctlplane-leaf1
    InternalApi: internal_api_leaf1
    Storage: storage_leaf1
    redis: internal_api_leaf1

b) For overcloud node ports:

Enrich 'networks' in roles defenition to include both
network and subnet data. Changes the list to a map
instead of a list of strings. New schema:

- name: <role_name>
  networks:
    <network_name>
      subnet: <subnet_name>

For backward compatibility a conditional is used to check
if the data is a map or not. In either case the internal
list of role networks is created as '_role_networks' in
the jinja2 templates.

When the data is a map, and the map contains the 'subnet'
key the subnet specified in roles_data.yaml is used as
the subnet in the fixed-ips-reqest when ports are created.
If subnet is not set (or role.networks is not a map) the
default will be {{network.name_lower}}_subnet.

Also, since the fixed_ips request passed to Vip ports are no
longer [] by default, the conditinal has been updated to
test for 'ip_address' entries in the request.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969
Change-Id: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443

"}, {'created': '2018-10-22 19:47:44.000000000', 'message': "L3 routed networks - subnet fixed_ips (3/3)

When using neutron routed networks we need to specify
either the subnet or a ip address in the fixed-ips-request
when creating neutron ports.

a) For the Vip's:

Adds VipSubnetMap and VipSubnetMapDefaults parameters in
service_net_map.yaml. The two maps are merged, so that the
operator can override the subnet where VIP port should be
hosted. For example:

parameter_defaults:
  VipSubnetMap:
    ctlplane: ctlplane-leaf1
    InternalApi: internal_api_leaf1
    Storage: storage_leaf1
    redis: internal_api_leaf1

b) For overcloud node ports:

Enrich 'networks' in roles defenition to include both
network and subnet data. Changes the list to a map
instead of a list of strings. New schema:

- name: <role_name>
  networks:

For backward compatibility a conditional is used to check
if the data is a map or not. In either case the internal

When the data is a map, and the map contains the 'subnet'
key the subnet specified in roles_data.yaml is used as

list of role networks is created as '_role_networks' in
the jinja2 templates.

When the data is a map, and the map contains the 'subnet'
key the subnet specified in roles_data.yaml is used as
the subnet in the fixed-ips-reqest when ports are created.
If subnet is not set (or role.networks is not a map) the
default will be {{network.name_lower}}_subnet.

Also, since the fixed_ips request passed to Vip ports are no
longer [] by default, the conditinal has been updated to
test for 'ip_address' entries in the request.

commit_message:
L3 routed networks - subnet fixed_ips (3/3)

When using neutron routed networks we need to specify
either the subnet or a ip address in the fixed-ips-request
when creating neutron ports.

a) For the Vip's:

Adds VipSubnetMap and VipSubnetMapDefaults parameters in
service_net_map.yaml. The two maps are merged, so that the
operator can override the subnet where VIP port should be
hosted. For example:

parameter_defaults:
  VipSubnetMap:
    ctlplane: ctlplane-leaf1
    InternalApi: internal_api_leaf1
    Storage: storage_leaf1
    redis: internal_api_leaf1

b) For overcloud node ports:

Enrich 'networks' in roles defenition to include both
network and subnet data. Changes the list to a map
instead of a list of strings. New schema:

- name: <role_name>
  networks:
    <network_name>
      subnet: <subnet_name>

For backward compatibility a conditional is used to check
if the data is a map or not. In either case the internal
list of role networks is created as '_role_networks' in
the jinja2 templates.

When the data is a map, and the map contains the 'subnet'
key the subnet specified in roles_data.yaml is used as
the subnet in the fixed-ips-reqest when ports are created.
If subnet is not set (or role.networks is not a map) the
default will be {{network.name_lower}}_subnet.

Also, since the fixed_ips request passed to Vip ports are no
longer [] by default, the conditinal has been updated to
test for 'ip_address' entries in the request.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969
Change-Id: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443

commit_message:
Fix tags for openshift images

The latest published image for cluster-monitoring-operator (v0.1.1) has
hardcoded tags for prometheus-config-reloader and prometheus-operator
images [1] that doesn't match the ones we set in tripleo.

In turn, prometheus-operator v0.23.2 requires specific version of
different images. This commit updates all image tags to a combination
that works out of the box.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/cluster-monitoring-operator/blob/v0.1.1/assets/prometheus-operator/deployment.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1809895
Change-Id: Ieea6d328d985199605f7d8b5cc654c011110621c
(cherry picked from commit cf3cd200d5569fc1c217ccabbc8599df4caf957e)

commit_message:
Remove MongoDB

MongoDB hasn't been supported since Pike, it's time to remove the
deployment files. Starting in Stein, it's not possible to deploy MongoDB
anymore. It already changes the default zaqar management_store to
sqlalchemy and the zaqar messaging_store to redis, which is already
set by TripleO Heat Templates.

Change-Id: I470a7e8c25293b2f2cb5420be124a8809481478a

[{'created': '2018-12-20 08:41:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add retries to HA bundles

The retry is needed in a composable HA environment because a two nodes
might be modifying the CIB at the same time and so we need to retry more
than once to get the freshest CIB, modify it and push it back. Currently
all HA resources have it but we did not add it in the bundles. While it
is a rare race, we should still plug it.

commit_message:
Add retries to HA bundles

The retry is needed in a composable HA environment because a two nodes
might be modifying the CIB at the same time and so we need to retry more
than once to get the freshest CIB, modify it and push it back. Currently
all HA resources have it but we did not add it in the bundles. While it
is a rare race, we should still plug it.

Change-Id: Ib9d9c76c83f103e329a9c575ae5c110d5ad3c048
Closes-Bug: #1809223

commit_message:
Add support for global DHCP options with OVN DHCP.

An operator may wish to set certain DHCP options
globally within an environment. This patch adds
configuration options to allow an operator to
specify DHCP option default values that may be
overriden by more specific configuration at the
subnet or port level.

Change-Id: I626c2dcd4ba66466b342da27a2ab50c3cac8b040
Closes-bug: 1785847
(cherry picked from commit dd20d827ffc76a4ade8a2f5fdd2c34e0a537617a)

[{'created': '2018-11-25 21:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for global DHCP options with OVN DHCP.

An operator may wish to set certain DHCP options
globally within an environment. This patch adds
configuration options to allow an operator to
specify DHCP option default values that may be
overriden by more specific configuration at the
subnet or port level.

Change-Id: I626c2dcd4ba66466b342da27a2ab50c3cac8b040
Closes-bug: 1785847
(cherry picked from commit 545d098bfaf089b8ce89b07bb05e66ed4125852b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for global DHCP options with OVN DHCP.

An operator may wish to set certain DHCP options
globally within an environment. This patch adds
configuration options to allow an operator to
specify DHCP option default values that may be
overriden by more specific configuration at the
subnet or port level.

Change-Id: I626c2dcd4ba66466b342da27a2ab50c3cac8b040
Closes-bug: 1785847
(cherry picked from commit 545d098bfaf089b8ce89b07bb05e66ed4125852b)

commit_message:
Add node host_ids to logstash fields

Add the nova hostId field to the logstash fields when it is provided
by nodepool for all nodes used in the build.

Change-Id: I3894da279132fa2d1c6160dd48573383e058677a

commit_message:
Add designate-status command for upgrade checks

This checks for duplicate entries in the service_statuses table
which will be an error after change
I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba.

Related-Bug: 1768824

Story: 2003657
Task: 26127

Change-Id: Ie0350b034f0eb03749138aadd0951d30073214c0
Co-authored-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-10-29 17:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

This seems really close now, thank you.

One important clarification still needed for me. There are two cases here: going into cell0 as ERROR and being in ERROR outside of cell0. Both fail today as the instance was never successfully built anywhere.

I think we should make this spec specific to the case where we are in cell0, i.e. the case where the instance would be in the Pending state.

I am beginning to regret the suggestion of these being two separate specs, but I think we are almost there now.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:23:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I am a little unsure in the dependency order between this one and the dependent change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554212/2

But I am happy with both of them now.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-12-03 20:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-12-04 09:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)

some questions'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-02 14:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

some minor typo/formatting issues noted within

Given that we have a system where instances can end up in cell0 (which might have been a strange decision) we need a way to get them out, so this seems like a thing that needs to happen.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(11 comments)

I've got nits and such inline and clarifications that could be added to firm this up, but given the spec freeze is around the corner for Stein and I think this is relatively straight-forward, and implementation details can be sorted out during code review and test, I'm leaning toward approval on this for Stein and the spec could be cleaned up in a follow up."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:16:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow+1

I'm just going to fast approve because John was +2 at PS7 which had a pep8 error, otherwise there were no functional differences. As noted, I'd like to see a follow up to cleanup the issues mentioned within, but that shouldn't hold this up from the spec freeze."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Enable rebuild for instances in cell0

Presently, it is allowed to rebuild servers in ERROR state, as long
as they have successfully started up before.

If a user tries to rebuild an instance in cell0, the request fails
with an exception of type InstanceInvalidState.

This spec summarizes the changes needed to enable the rebuilding of
instances that failed during creation.

Change-Id: I3cf92b987da014e8b01f8b1a3f774b03ce3bb0b7
Implements: blueprint enable-rebuild-for-instances-in-cell0

commit_message:
Updated External deprecation badge resource

In order to be fully functional to be consumable from
an external project ( ie docthemes)

- removed from external deprecation badge references to
boostrap css and font awesome css
- removed relative references to js and css and made it
absolutes

Change-Id: I07809ba90a4a7cae996994a856d9d6be9d7a1195

commit_message:
Move linter dependencies out of test-requirements

These requirements are expanded into the sdist tarball,
however they're not needed for building or runnig tests.
Move them into the pep8 target.

Change-Id: Ice851200a45538be4dd27736674fcd7315ed87a3

commit_message:
Avoid failure to install zuul when venv exists

Fixes case where a succesfull creation of the
virtualenv but failure to install zuul would
make the function useless as it would always
miss installing zull.

Change-Id: Ie5ef82765120094e8147b05443626e2012273fba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-24 09:42:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix CI failed: test_get_volume_filter_options_using_config

Recently, CI failed(py27, py35 and other unit tests) due to
test_get_volume_filter_options_using_config case.

In patch[1], we remove deprecated query_volume_filters config option,
but the test case is fixed by a wrong way. The
``CONF.resource_query_filters_file`` is a **json path**, but NOT a
**json str**, if we want to overwrite it, we should overwrite the
_FILTERS_COLLECTION.[2]

Unfortunately, if we have already called the _initialize_filters in
other case (before this case), this error will not be exposed. So, we
didn't found this error happened in first-CI.

This patch try to fix this issue.

Closes-bug: #1809647

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620632/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620632/2/cinder/api/common.py@356

commit_message:
Fix CI failed: test_get_volume_filter_options_using_config

Recently, CI failed(py27, py35 and other unit tests) due to
test_get_volume_filter_options_using_config case.

In patch[1], we remove deprecated query_volume_filters config option,
but the test case is fixed by a wrong way. The
``CONF.resource_query_filters_file`` is a **json path**, but NOT a
**json str**, if we want to overwrite it, we should overwrite the
_FILTERS_COLLECTION.[2]

Unfortunately, if we have already called the _initialize_filters in
other case (before this case), this error will not be exposed. So, we
didn't find this error occurring in first-CI.

This patch try to fix this issue.

Co-Authored-By: wanghao <sxmatch1986@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1809647

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620632/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620632/2/cinder/api/common.py@356

Change-Id: I190cc67a001ffce2a533480e6e39e26cd3f981df

commit_message:
Update the embedded-ansible-setup process to be configurable

This change allows the embedded ansible process to be configurable by
the end user.
  * Python requirements and ansible roles will all now be user
    configurable.
  * Setup is now a local only playbook. This playbook replaces the bash
    commands we were rerunning when the `bootstrap-embedded-ansible.sh`
    script was executed.
  * Embedded ansible version is now 2.7.5 as default.
  * Deprecation warnings have been resolved.
  * Tests impacted by this change have been updated.

Change-Id: I4303c44e249cda31457a4f05a681e298d225a8b7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix NP creation when it has namespaceSelector

The default result for the operation of getting matched pods does not
matches how the function of getting pods ips works. This commit fixes
the issue by modifing the default value.

Closes-Bug: 1810442
Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

Change-Id: I07f72b85b81f02cfdf22d7e7df0afa3988fa10af

commit_message:
Makes tempest sendmail failure easier to track

This task can fail with various errors and this change enables us
to spot its failure with a single LogStash query.

In order to avoid false positive string match when bash is using verbose
more we encoded the W char in the source, so a string match would happen
only when printed and not on the source code.

Change-Id: Icbb7f71aba2e9d2a4cf4e4c07f953fe3613e6707
Partial-Bug: 1806495

[{'created': '2019-01-04 10:46:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472
(cherry picked from commit 9b23abbdb68f7e0c80c305ec1874281f6dea7e9e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472
(cherry picked from commit 9b23abbdb68f7e0c80c305ec1874281f6dea7e9e)

commit_message:
Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472
(cherry picked from commit 9b23abbdb68f7e0c80c305ec1874281f6dea7e9e)

commit_message:
Increase size for security hardened images

With the move to containers there has been an increase of
demand on the /var volume. Increase the global size.

Change-Id: Ib806bac815077c2508060719469b5d0f1acc0f99
(cherry picked from commit 83c7887ffb361b33cd150098708fe3e06ea5e77b)

commit_message:
Increase size for security hardened images

With the move to containers there has been an increase of
demand on the /var volume. Increase the global size, as well
as give more percentage to /var and reduce /root.

Also fix fsck-passno setting, that was incorrectly set.

Change-Id: I8d820f668ffffe5993d5fef38e0c1e8c5f5862ec
Depends-On: Ib806bac815077c2508060719469b5d0f1acc0f99
(cherry picked from commit aa19a7f92af8d7683b84221550f3850ceec85363)

commit_message:
Add kayobe seed service upgrade command

Adds a new command to upgrade containerised services on the seed:

kayobe seed service upgrade

This is largely the same as the deploy command, since there is no
kolla-ansible bifrost-upgrade command yet.

A limitation in Bifrost requires us to remove IPA images before
upgrading the bifrost container.

Change-Id: Ibbe01e972487e69dbb753a67efcf13e3ae0800de
Story: 2004308
Task: 27872
Task: 28657

commit_message:
Add kayobe seed service upgrade command

Adds a new command to upgrade containerised services on the seed:

kayobe seed service upgrade

This is largely the same as the deploy command, since there is no
kolla-ansible bifrost-upgrade command yet.

A limitation in Bifrost requires us to remove IPA images before
upgrading the bifrost container.

Change-Id: Ibbe01e972487e69dbb753a67efcf13e3ae0800de
Story: 2004308
Task: 27872
Task: 28657

[{'account_id': 29256, 'date': '2018-12-07 08:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-07 08:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-12-07 11:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Provisional -1.
This commit changes the existing behavior of the CIDR validation.
Looking at the bug report, the problem happens because the neutron receives non-zero CIDR representation for a subnet CIDR.
If so, how about converting CIDR representation so that the CIDR has zeros for host part of CIDR rather than having non-zero IPs for the host part?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-26 09:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 29256, 'date': '2018-12-27 08:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29256, 'date': '2018-12-27 08:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Provisional -1.
 > This commit changes the existing behavior of the CIDR validation.
 > Looking at the bug report, the problem happens because the neutron
 > receives non-zero CIDR representation for a subnet CIDR.
 > If so, how about converting CIDR representation so that the CIDR
 > has zeros for host part of CIDR rather than having non-zero IPs for
 > the host part?

Thanks much for the comments!
1. About CIDR representation:
	Following use invalid CIDR "192.168.1.1/24" as an example:
	1.1. A valid CIDR "192.168.1.0/24" represent a IP range.
	1.2. A valid CIDR "192.168.1.1/32" represent a IP address.
	So we don't know if the user incorrectly entered the address or the prefix length so any assumption we make has a 50/50 chance of being incorrect.
	It is recommended to remind the user by returning an error message.

2. About the wrong use of the word "invalidate"
	I have modified it according to your opinion.
	
Thanks much for the comments again!'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-12-31 13:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Provisional -1.
 > > This commit changes the existing behavior of the CIDR validation.
 > > Looking at the bug report, the problem happens because the
 > neutron
 > > receives non-zero CIDR representation for a subnet CIDR.
 > > If so, how about converting CIDR representation so that the CIDR
 > > has zeros for host part of CIDR rather than having non-zero IPs
 > for
 > > the host part?
 > 
 > Thanks much for the comments!
 > 1. About CIDR representation:
 > Following use invalid CIDR "192.168.1.1/24" as an example:
 > 1.1. A valid CIDR "192.168.1.0/24" represent a IP range.
 > 1.2. A valid CIDR "192.168.1.1/32" represent a IP address.
 > So we don't know if the user incorrectly entered the address or the
 > prefix length so any assumption we make has a 50/50 chance of being
 > incorrect.
 > It is recommended to remind the user by returning an error message.
 > 
 > 2. About the wrong use of the word "invalidate"
 > I have modified it according to your opinion.
 > 
 > Thanks much for the comments again!

IMO it is good to return error message to user in such case. Otherwise we can sometimes silently change subnet which user wanted to configure and that can lead to some issues which may be hard to debug and sometimes hard to fix later when cidrs are already in use.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-31 17:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

Leaving +W to ensure we get 1 more set of eyes on this before landing it as it seems to update existing validation behavior.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2018-12-31 18:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-01-01 14:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Generally speaking, I am not against the change, but I have two concerns.

The first one is what I raised in the past comment, but other reviewers already agreed silent API changes. Pre-stein neutron accepts non-network address but stein neutron denies non-network address. We haven't introduced the micro-versioning mechanism so there seems no easy way to handle this kind of cases. A shim extension seems too much to me too. Thus, I am okay if other reviewers are okay with this.

The second point is about upgrade scenarios. Existing deployments may have non-network address as "destination". How should we handle this kind of addresses in existing deployments? This is no problem if the existing code in the neutron repo already handles this case, but it is worth checked. The commit message says "Closes-Bug", so it is better to be checked before merging the change. Otherwise, this should be "Partial-Bug".'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-01-02 01:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Modify the judgment method of CIDR and Add utests

The routing table could not add information, because
the original method could not identify the invalid CIDR.
This patch modify the judgement method. It will help
the router working normally.

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I4db2e35303492aeda7e14cf9d525cc9b4a54ac36
Closes-Bug: #1805991
Story: 2004567

commit_message:
Fix twine check that is breaking CI

Currently the test-release-openstack job is failing on the pike and queens
branches with the following error:

twine check dist/*
Checking distribution dist/kayobe-4.0.1.dev6-py2-none-any.whl: Failed
The project's long_description has invalid markup which will not be rendered on PyPI. The following syntax errors were detected:
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation.
Checking distribution dist/kayobe-4.0.1.dev6.tar.gz: Failed
The project's long_description has invalid markup which will not be rendered on PyPI. The following syntax errors were detected:
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation.
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation

This is fixed by putting the project's description on a single line.

Change-Id: I8a44c4e6275889b2842135002c8adfc8b8efd834

commit_message:
Fix twine check that is breaking CI

Currently the test-release-openstack job is failing on the pike and queens
branches with the following error:

twine check dist/*
Checking distribution dist/kayobe-4.0.1.dev6-py2-none-any.whl: Failed
The project's long_description has invalid markup which will not be rendered on PyPI. The following syntax errors were detected:
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation.
Checking distribution dist/kayobe-4.0.1.dev6.tar.gz: Failed
The project's long_description has invalid markup which will not be rendered on PyPI. The following syntax errors were detected:
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation.
line 7: Error: Unexpected indentation

This is fixed by putting the project's description on a single line.

Change-Id: I8a44c4e6275889b2842135002c8adfc8b8efd834

subject: Quote and escape extra vars passed to ansible
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-19 18:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-12-20 09:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16984, 'date': '2019-01-04 10:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-04 13:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

overcloud upgrade timed out after 2.5 hours...'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 18:42:51.000000000', 'message': 'Quote and escape extra vars passed to ansible

Arguments passed as extra variables to Ansible require double escaping.
This can be seen when running the following command:

kayobe physical network configure --interface-description-limit 'interface 42'

This gets passed to ansible-playbook as:

['-e', 'physical_network_interface_description_limit=interface 42']

Ansible for some reason loses the 42 from the description. This can be
worked around via quoting:

kayobe physical network configure --interface-description-limit '"interface 42"'

Which results in:

['-e', 'physical_network_interface_description_limit="interface 42"']

This change adds quoting and escaping of variables passed to
ansible-playbook in this way.

Note that this change does not modify any extra variables passed to
kayobe via the -e argument, instead keeping the behaviour of this
argument the same as that of the Ansible -e argument.

Change-Id: I51d5112b8f94998f948fe5b8cb9a927ee7ed8cec
Story: 2004379
Task: 27993
'}]
commit_message:
Quote and escape extra vars passed to ansible

Arguments passed as extra variables to Ansible require double escaping.
This can be seen when running the following command:

kayobe physical network configure --interface-description-limit 'interface 42'

This gets passed to ansible-playbook as:

['-e', 'physical_network_interface_description_limit=interface 42']

Ansible for some reason loses the 42 from the description. This can be
worked around via quoting:

kayobe physical network configure --interface-description-limit '"interface 42"'

Which results in:

['-e', 'physical_network_interface_description_limit="interface 42"']

This change adds quoting and escaping of variables passed to
ansible-playbook in this way.

Note that this change does not modify any extra variables passed to
kayobe via the -e argument, instead keeping the behaviour of this
argument the same as that of the Ansible -e argument.

Change-Id: I51d5112b8f94998f948fe5b8cb9a927ee7ed8cec
Story: 2004379
Task: 27993

commit_message:
enable Keystone v3 support for http_check detection plugin

To properly support Keystone V3, we must also properly convey
the domain information to the Keystone authentication plugins.

Change-Id: I8c6539cf692e090290cfdf104eb22530a625aadb
story: 2004655

commit_message:
Pin bundler to 1.17.3

bundler 2.0.0 is released which needs ruby >= 2.3.0 and rubygems >= 3.0
but we are behind, so let's pin bundler to 1.17.3.

Closes-Bug: #1810401
Change-Id: Ia1190e36443e8ae24219d62771a9fd5ad46e8b25
(cherry picked from commit 43ec9b923280037013038ae2f4e0a51769ed513b)

commit_message:
Make centos-7-containers-multinode non voting

Job blocking the gate by timeing out in most execututions without
any infrastructure causing it to do so, just slow deployment time.

Change-Id: Id9f1731754cad1444a73fce146ef29d3674f7fc1
Related-Bug: #1806632

subject: Add RBAC policies feature to horizon dashboard
messages:
[{'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-21 07:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-21 08:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-21 09:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-22 06:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-22 08:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-22 09:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thanks for your patch. neutron RBAC support is a long-standing backlog in horizon.

While I haven't checked the detail, there are several points I would like to mention.
- Could you file a blueprint to horizon launchpad?
- Unit test coverage is required
- A release note is needed

In addition to above (related to a blueprint), we would like to know the whole picture of this effort. RBAC CURS operations are part of neutron RBAC support. If we support neutron RBAC for neutron network completely, we also need to fix the logic to retrieving neutron networks (the current logic does not take into account networks shared via RBAC)."}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-22 10:01:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Thanks for your patch. neutron RBAC support is a long-standing
 > backlog in horizon.
 > 
 > While I haven't checked the detail, there are several points I
 > would like to mention.
 > - Could you file a blueprint to horizon launchpad?
 > - Unit test coverage is required
 > - A release note is needed
 > 
 > In addition to above (related to a blueprint), we would like to
 > know the whole picture of this effort. RBAC CURS operations are
 > part of neutron RBAC support. If we support neutron RBAC for
 > neutron network completely, we also need to fix the logic to
 > retrieving neutron networks (the current logic does not take into
 > account networks shared via RBAC).

Thanks for your advice!
I will fix the above requirements after finished RBAC feature."}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-26 06:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-27 08:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-11-27 11:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Akihiro, the neutron retrieval takes the RBAC into account'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-29 04:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-29 04:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-29 09:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-29 15:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> @Akihiro, the neutron retrieval takes the RBAC into account

@Gary, how should the project network table behave with admin role?
Generally speaking, the project panel focuses on showing networks owned by a user (+ networks shared from other projects) even if admin user. Neutron API returns all networks from all projects so horizon is forced to filter networks which fit into the project panel. This is the point I mean.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-29 15:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

You can find openstack_dashboard.api.neutorn.network_list_for_tenant does the magic. It mirrors the neutron logic, but once RBAC is introduced I have no good idea on how to change this method to achieve the role of the project network panel. This issue blocks me to implement RBAC feature for a long time over multiple years. Any nice idea is really appreciated.

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py#L1052'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-30 06:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-30 06:59:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> You can find openstack_dashboard.api.neutorn.network_list_for_tenant
 > does the magic. It mirrors the neutron logic, but once RBAC is
 > introduced I have no good idea on how to change this method to
 > achieve the role of the project network panel. This issue blocks me
 > to implement RBAC feature for a long time over multiple years. Any
 > nice idea is really appreciated.
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py#L1052

@Akihiro, I haven't seen how neutron implement RBAC, but I used rbac to create a policy to share a network under a project to another project, and verifying in horizon that the target network entry was actually added to network table under another project."}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-30 08:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-11-30 09:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 03:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 03:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 05:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 05:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 06:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2018-12-04 07:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-16 20:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2018-12-14 14:00:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix test failures for new dnspython module

Release dnspython==1.16.0 has fixed a bug which didn't apply the zone
default TTL to records without an explicit TTL. Since there doesn't seem
to be a way to accomodate both the old and new behaviour in our tests,
set an explicit TTL for all our sample records.

Change-Id: I2d4cd55b69da696a9d4b25213969248a4c2e6119
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test failures for new dnspython module

Release dnspython==1.16.0 has fixed a bug which didn't apply the zone
default TTL to records without an explicit TTL. Since there doesn't seem
to be a way to accomodate both the old and new behaviour in our tests,
set an explicit TTL for all our sample records.

Change-Id: I2d4cd55b69da696a9d4b25213969248a4c2e6119

commit_message:
Pin bundler to 1.17.3

bundler 2.0.0 is released which needs ruby >= 2.3.0 and rubygems >= 3.0
but we are behind, so let's pin bundler to 1.17.3.

Closes-Bug: #1810401
Change-Id: Ia1190e36443e8ae24219d62771a9fd5ad46e8b25
(cherry picked from commit 43ec9b923280037013038ae2f4e0a51769ed513b)

commit_message:
Fix linters in role and make them fit oooq rules

Add linter rule with pipefail when using shell module
and pipe.
Fix linter issues in role - pipefail for shell.
See also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564472/

Change-Id: Ie615b05dffc374972a8f3629485a4413e85d331d

Change-Id: Ie615b05dffc374972a8f3629485a4413e85d331d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix linters in role and make them fit oooq rules

Add linter rule with pipefail when using shell module
and pipe.
Fix linter issues in role - pipefail for shell.
See also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564472/

Change-Id: Ie615b05dffc374972a8f3629485a4413e85d331d

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-30 14:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-04-30 14:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-09-20 16:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

BAH, I really hate to -1 this patch.  However there is talk about making the build-test-package role a formal ansible-role-tripleo-$ role.  Adding the inclusion of the this step I could see complicating that effort.

Can we break this out into it's own role?"}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-09-20 16:49:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

If it's easier done after this merges.. that is ok too. Let me know how you would like to proceed."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-09-21 04:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I think we agreed a long time ago that this roles purpose is actually to get changes and to apply them. And it doesn't matter where the changes are - in RPM package, python ansible role, or anywhere else.

I don't see where it complicates something. Currently we use ugly hacks to get changes into roles: https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/playbooks/tripleo-ci/templates/toci_gate_test.sh.j2#L142-L155

And this actually will allow us to remove these hacks. Extracting it to separate role shouldn't affect anything."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-04 15:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Install changes in additional roles for quickstart

Use build-test-packages role for installing changes in additional
roles that are installed for tripleo-quickstart. If role was
installed before, build-test-packages role will reinstall it with
Gerrit/Zuul changes applied.

Change-Id: I87c2dff4b53a39bd81557be9189a96bf8a721c79

parsed output of subnode IPs.
